Review.Titre: FALSE ADVERTISING
Review.Contenu: Multiple places on the website say their locations can be used for business registration (with a state), but that is not true. And, you have to buy it before you find out this is false. They don't inform you upfront which locations do not, nor do they post a disclaimer, nor do they provide a phone number to contact the location to determine if they are registered as a PMB in the state. Wasted a lot of time on this. Rep told me I'm not the only one who calls in about this, so clearly they don't care they mislead people.

Review.Titre: Discarding mail.This company has admittedly
Review.Contenu: This company has admittedly, by one employee, indiscriminately discarded all my paid subscription magazines, for months, "We get piles of magazine, catalogs and junk mail"Their app freezes up constantly having to turn off my cell phone off and back on. Suggested by their employee. They know their app sucks. I do not trust them

Review.Titre: I initiated a package forwarding…
Review.Contenu: I initiated a package forwarding request for items held at the Staples store and completed the payment. However, the packages were not forwarded as agreed. Upon contacting iPostal1 for assistance, I was directed back to the Staples store. Then when I contacted the Staples store, I was directed back to iPostal1. This back-and-forth experience has been challenging. Nobody wants to take responsibility because they don't want to deal with customer service. Obviously, there are some serious issues within the management team.December 18, 2023 Update:Packages are still not shipped out. They provided tracking number but they never shipped it out. I'm going to file a police report and talk with my attorney for fraudulent behaviors within iPostal1 and Staples employees

Review.Titre: It was great until it wasn't
Review.Contenu: Initially, I had a positive experience. My mail was sent out on time. However, the situation changed when they started to delay scanning items, and my mail was not being sent out promptly. Moreover, some of my mail started getting lost, which was a major concern, especially when it involved my business checks. Ipostal claimed that the missing items were not in their possession, and the shipping providers couldn't help either as they never received the mail. This is affecting my business significantly, and I can't afford to keep losing my business checks or to be on top of the mail when I have a business to run. I was okay with paying the fees and dealing with late scans. The lost checks are unacceptable. As a result, I am currently looking for a new business mailbox service provider because they are unreliable.NY location Staples 5th Avenue 10018

Review.Titre: Dismal Mail Service Experience
Review.Contenu: I recently had an incredibly frustrating experience with this mail service. Never before have I had to actively chase down my own mail. Attempting to get in touch with the person responsible for issuing my mail has been a fruitless endeavor – the communication system is abysmal. Despite scheduling several pickups, there has been no correspondence whatsoever. For business owners in need of timely mail services, I strongly advise against using this service. I won't be utilizing it again.

Review.Titre: There are additional steps and cost…
Review.Contenu: There are additional steps and cost required before you can get your mail. These cost and steps are not disclosed until after you’ve paid to set up the address. Secondly, the mail room, is a spare office of another company who just has everyone’s mail in a pile. Not secure or professional.

Review.Titre: discrimination based on nationality
Review.Contenu: I am a Russian national currently residing in Portugal and recently had an experience with this service that I feel compelled to share. Despite my residence in Portugal, the company denied me service explicitly based on my Russian nationality. This decision was particularly perplexing and disappointing, as I am aware of fellow Russians who were able to use this service in the past, before the recent global changes. It's disheartening to encounter such inconsistency in service provision.

Review.Titre: Extremely bad service.
Review.Contenu: Extremely bad service.No replies on my emails.No decent support for anything.Charging money from my PayPal account without any need for payment, and when i asked them, they told me it's in your balance, while my balance was Zero. When i asked for a refund, they didn't refund all the money claiming that the system only refund 10s ! What is this.I sent 2 packages to my iPostal address, and i've been confirmed with the delivery, when i asked iPostal about those packages, they don't reply on my on mail nor chat nothing. After paying a year of subscription, that happened (typical).Strongly don't recommend getting this service even for Free.. keep away from them, they are scammers.

Review.Titre: No response to my questions
Review.Contenu: I have been trying to contact ipostal1 for days now but to no avail. Phones only have recordings the majority of the time and I have yet to get any calls returned. I have been emailing as well. I have extra charges on my PayPal account and no one is returning my calls.  I have tried online chat but of course, the answers it gives you are program answers. I am very unsatisfied with ipostal.  This is my first time using them. Not sure if I am going to continue with their services if no one can return my calls and answer my questions. The emails I have received from them do not respond to the extra fees I'm being charged.

Review.Titre: Two months still no mail delivered?
Review.Contenu: It has been two months since I started service, & as yet nothing in my accounts inbox? I'm beginning to have second thoughts about your service. I even stopped at my iPostal location, still no mail? Why? Is it because the USPS not forwarding mail? I even stopped & talked with the staff, & I was told they would follow-up? It's been a week since I made my inquiry at the Happy Valley, Oregon location. I just got my first piece of mail with $9.55 due from a Wiley Peanut Company located in Hays, Virginia that I didn't order? So I'm probably going to return it? Maybe it's a gift? And I never ordered anything. But no other mail has been delivered. Wierd?

Review.Titre: I thought there will be locker and…
Review.Contenu: I thought there will be locker and package might be handle securely. But found it open on billing desk. Employee was searching in staple for the package whole over staples. Totally disappointment with service.  Will surely terminate it once package I gave this address are received. I want my money back.

Review.Titre: business address is useless, no refund offered
Review.Contenu: I got the iPostal1 virtual address, but I was not able to get business license with the city since they do not accept virtual business addresses, they were immediately detected it's inside Office Depot. Same did my bank - they said it's not a true office. California state, not sure about other states. IPostal1 refused to refund the fee payment.

Review.Titre: If I could give 0 Stars I would…Stay away! Bad business!!!!!!!!!
Review.Contenu: This merchant closed my account without contacting me at all so it was out of nowhere because they charged me for something unrelated to this mailbox that I have a confirmation saying was a trial called istop for unwanted mail… NOT MY MAILBOX … which I also closed upon seeing it not only charged me but no one responded for support although the email says 0.00 and I haven’t been able to access since (due to closing it during the trial period to make sure I didn’t get more unexpected charges), they never responded before it was disputed to any email and it was disputed after that which I have proof of. This is extremely bad business! Stay away! I paid for a yearly subscription and a scan and shred bundle which I am now disputing on this account since the mailbox no longer exists meaning I didn’t get what I paid for!!!! This is the worst business ever! Very shady!!!!!!

Review.Titre: iPostal gave me a huge hassle trying to…
Review.Contenu: Edit: "many people do not use services like pick up"?? People don't pick up their mail? I find the copypasta response below to be insincere and intentionally disregarding of my concerns.I also just went through the entire process of setting up an account just to verify there is ABSOLUTELY NO notification of any additional charge outside of the 9.99/mo mentioned anywhere. Letting people know after they get mail that they have to pay to pick it up is unethical and outright intentionally deceptive.iPostal gave me a huge hassle trying to setup the account and the customer service was absolutely awful. Unresponsive and incompetent.Now, out of nowhere, I found out that every time I receive a letter I have to pay to pick it up??? This is extortion. Not once was it mentioned that there was an additional charge for picking up mail.Very strongly do not recommend this service. Super shady.

Review.Titre: I have been a customer since February no mail
Review.Contenu: I have been a customer since February. To date, I have not been getting any mail. Correspondence from banks, IRS, and businesses.  This is terrible. I even mailed correspondence to myself, but 9 months later, still nothing. I made several trips to the facility, but the reps there were unhelpful

Review.Titre: No help, no email, no response.
Review.Contenu: I have been having nothing but issues with your company. I made a formal complaint via text and no one from your company has reached out to me with my questions. Representative said that I could change my location. I’ve had several issues with my location and your company does not get back to me. As I mentioned to the agent, I am going to file a formal complaint with the Better Business Bureau if my situation is not handled correctly.

Review.Titre: Not happy with the cost to ship…
Review.Contenu: This score is no reflection to customer support. This is strictly about postal1. I was Told and signed up for this service because I live in California however my business is registered in Louisiana. I wanted Something where i could Have a physical address and somewhere items can be returned. The cost to half postal one ship an item is ridiculous. I was Being charge $48 to ship a package less than 1pound. I will Have to cancel my service and find something else because that is extremely to expensive

Review.Titre: Horrible customer service
Review.Contenu: Horrible customer service, they charge without setting up mail box as promised. My all mail was lost. Just horrible!

Review.Titre: I wasn't aware I'd have to pay each…
Review.Contenu: I wasn't aware I'd have to pay each time to pick up my mail. I would not have signed up for this service

Review.Titre: Buyer Beware
Review.Contenu: From the moment you submit your application for a P.O. Box, iPostal1 will start billing you.  Your mailbox will not be activated:  any mail you receive will be SENT BACK- return to sender.  Your mail will not actually be delivered to you until after you meet many additional requirements which in my case, took two months to complete.  You will be billed for this time.  Your mail will be returned to sender and yet you will pay and continue to be billed.  This is not a very attractive business model (well not very attractive for the customer at least).  If you complain about it you will be told too bad, this is what you signed up for.  Read the fine print.  My local store told me that there are NUMEROUS applicants on "pending" status who are having their mail returned to sender and yet still getting billed by iPostal.

Review.Titre: Deceptive business practice
Review.Contenu: Deceptive business practice.  Unauthorized fees. Three weeks into my first month of my new online mailbox, I went to pick up two packages both under the 10 day free storage time frame.  On the 11th day, I had no mail in my box or at the location and they attempted to charge my credit card 50 dollars for "storage fees".  There should not have been any storage fees.  I was IRATE.  I closed my box immediately.  There was no explanation for the fees.  They just closed the account. So basically if you don't catch the false billing you would never know.  I only caught it because the charge was denied.  And this reply to my review below is incorrect and proves my point.  Even if I went past 10 days and I did not, it would have been $2.20 for another 10 days per my mailbox provider.  Stop lying on my review.  You falsely tried to bill me 50 dollars for no reason.

Review.Titre: Additional fees not disclosed.
Review.Contenu: I'm not happy at all. I get charged $10 a month, plus on top of that I'm also charged an additional fee EACH time I pick up my package. These additional fees weren't diaclosed when signing up.

Review.Titre: LOST PACKAGES WITH NO EXPLANATION
Review.Contenu: My first time ever using iPostal1. I went to pick up 3 packages that were confirmed to have been delivered and only received one package. They lost 2 packages - unfortunately, these were business deliveries and not receiving them caused me to lose out on money.

Review.Titre: I have visited 3x to try and pick up my…
Review.Contenu: I have visited 3x to try and pick up my mail.  I was told the hours of operations  IA 20am to 4pm.  I am. Here for the third  time an no one is available  and the sa.w sign we will be back by 10 am tomorrow.   IS this a SCAM? I THOUGHT  I WOULD HAVE A CODE OR SOMETHING  AND CAN COME AND PICK UP  MY mail at any time  instead of depending  on someone to be here.  Please  advise how this is supposed to work?.

Review.Titre: Lack of responsibility in customer service
Review.Contenu: Pros:* Exceptional customer service at some locations: Certain iPostal1 stores offer outstanding customer service and make the process of managing your mail and packages a positive experience.Cons:* High fees for forwarding and scanning: Many iPostal1 locations charge exorbitant fees for forwarding and scanning services, making them significantly more expensive than other mail and package management options.* Mishandling and missing packages: There are numerous reports of packages being mishandled by store employees, resulting in damage, loss, or even theft. In my own experience, I encountered two stores where staff attempted to steal my packages.* Inconsistent service quality: The level of service provided by iPostal1 varies greatly across different locations. While some stores offer exceptional service, others are characterized by high fees, inadequate security measures, and mishandled packages.Recommendation:While some iPostal1 locations may provide excellent customer service and convenient solutions for mail and package management, the inconsistent quality, high fees, and security concerns raise significant red flags. I strongly recommend researching individual locations based on online reviews and choosing alternative options if reports of missing packages or theft are prevalent.Update (December 14, 2023):iPostal1 appears to disregard my status as a customer, despite the verified status of review and issues I have experienced with their service. This behavior can be perceived as gaslighting, as they fail to take responsibility for their actions and provide adequate customer service.Update (December 15, 2023):iPostal1 has contacted me by email, providing extensive information about pricing. However, I am disappointed that they did not offer any solutions to assist with my lost packages. As a result, I intend to maintain my negative review until my packages are located. Additionally, there are concerns that they attempt to suppress legitimate negative reviews on Trustpilot. Therefore, I would advise against engaging with this company, as they may not encourage open and honest feedback from their customers.

Review.Titre: Terrible instructions for set up
Review.Contenu: It has been two months and I just received my first piece of mail. IPostal ensured me that everything was set up including notarized Form 1583. But they didn’t tell me we actually had to change our address with USPS separately. I was able to do mine online, but my usps said my husband had to do it in person, with 2 forms of ID, which he can’t because we are now living in another country. So his mail, including important bills, is still going to our old house, with no way for us to retrieve it. So frustrating!

Review.Titre: I would recommend finding another…
Review.Contenu: Wished I tried another provider. It cost 3 X the notary fee to correct a form that was correct the 2nd time because they couldn't see on their end what I had uploaded clearly on my end. Ipostal claims the P.O needs this form but nobody, including two separate post office master generals, had ever seen the form and swore this was not the correct form. I requested the Post Office verify my credentials and fill it out the best they can anyway, then took to notary.  After several attempts to upload with the "form team" it was requested I email it. It was not accepted, and they sent instructions for the form. It was done correctly and notarized again. I used the email feature, not the website. Then I was not notified that they refused to approve the ID docs. That was NEVER THE CASE!!!! They then began sending repeated emails that they needed the form filled out properly and my form matched their request.  I sent an email asking they look at their request and look at the form and to call me because clearly it was correct to their specifications. Nobody called. Long and short of it was in the end.. they had what they asked me for when I uploaded it with a link they sent the first time. They couldn't or didn't upload it from their end. I was requested to upload again while on the phone with the 3rd person I was pawned to trying to resolve this. I showed her the document was the same as before and was now there twice, but she was able to approve it immediately.  Ipostal has an entire department and a link and a "form team" for this one document because their site is complicated. They have contracts with stores to receive the mail and these stores can't do much, but they said they take a lot of complaints.  I spent far too much time getting tossed between staples and ipostal to find that a call back could have saved me two weeks of frustration. The only reason I keep it is because I began using the address and don't have time to start over.

Review.Titre: Quoted prices are not accurate.  Much higher.
Review.Contenu: Quoted prices were not what the business charges.  I bought a 9.99 plan and it lists the prices included. The prices at the business are much higher and the services are not included The prices are not transparent.  It's a bait and switch.  Im going back to a different virtual mailbox company that is honest.

Review.Titre: I have to drive fast 30 miles from my…
Review.Contenu: I have to drive fast 30 miles from my home to get there. Also, I always have to call 1st before going to the mailbox. It's not normal business hours and that sucks. I would only suggest this to people who have no other choice than to use your service.

Review.Titre: Orlando location at 6249 Edgewater Dr
Review.Contenu: I used their Orlando location at 6249 Edgewater Dr. They changed their location and didn't even inform any of their users that the forwarding mailing address has been changed. I urge everyone to not use their service better use the actual USPS or UPS mailboxes for a few more $.

Review.Titre: Looked through my mail
Review.Contenu: They went through my mail, my package was opened and then denied because it was a white powder (hair supplement) do not trust this company. Horrible customer service too never told my why I didn’t get my mail until a month later after ignoring my emails and calls.EDIT!: Read their reply, they admit they go through your mail, do you want that?

Review.Titre: I visited the box 2 times already and…
Review.Contenu: I visited the box 2 times already and the information in the mail box belong to someone else. One suggestion can the area have a box set up area with lockers with keys instead of having mails in a file draw in file folders. The associates seems to have problem finding the mails when asked for. They need a better system

Review.Titre: What a Nightmare!
Review.Contenu: Their setup process was a nightmare. All the requested information was provided including photos of IDs and proof of address. My application was on hold for 2 weeks until they sent a plain text email saying my proof of address photo needs to be resent. When it was plenty clear for their online notary to read read and verify. Now I finally get mail, and their system tells the physical location to scan the mail image, and shred the mail! That option is not selected on the account. The option to set a pickup time for the envelope which is from the IRS is still selectable. I didn't know the envelope was shredded until I went to pickup the mail. Thanks iPostal! Big help. I'll be riding out the year, since I prepaid, then i'll be switching services. Unless this sort of thing keeps happening, then I'll just write off the advance payment.

Review.Titre: Customer support isn’t great
Review.Contenu: Customer support isn’t great. Once you submit a support ticket, you can wait a loooooong time before getting a response.

Review.Titre: No mails received!!!
Review.Contenu: Purchased this service after reading all the great reviews - big mistake! A customer sent us a check to the address - no notification whatsoever. They cancelled the order and we lost a sale worth over $1000 dollars. We sent ourselves a letter to our own address to test the service - no notification or indication we received any mail. Emailed their customer service to inquire about this issue. Twenty-four hours later, no response. Makes me wonder about all these “great”reviews.

Review.Titre: In addition to all the other charges…
Review.Contenu: In addition to all the other charges they have for "service" they add $16.95 just to simply mail a check to a bank so it can be deposited? What a joke. This business seems to specialize in creating additional special fees. Maybe more importantly they don't provide any transparency up front so customers will only figure out how greedy they are after it's too late.

Review.Titre: Bad experience.
Review.Contenu: Bad experience.Wasnt able to get through the initial set up process. Was too complicated and customer service was unhelpful through the situation.

Review.Titre: The sign up process was exhausting
Review.Contenu: The sign up process was exhausting. I finally got some help and completed the process to find the same lack of help in accessing my in box.  It has been two weeks since I had my mail forwarded and nothing is in my in box and no one will help me find out why.  They actually asked me why I was calling and what was I expecting and that it frequently takes a month or more for stuff to show up in the inbox.  When I explained I was expecting bank statement and bills they asked me how often I get this type of mail.  What a moron!  I wish I had never started the process.

Review.Titre: Mail and packages were delivered to…
Review.Contenu: Received notification from shipper that mail and packages were delivered to location more than a week ago, yet was told I couldn’t receive them until they “logged” it in their system and this was supposed to take a few more days. Customer service at the store was very rude and unprofessional. You are better off simply going directly to the post office or UPS.

Review.Titre: I never saw anything in the marketing…
Review.Contenu: I never saw anything in the marketing about $1 per package to pickup.You say, "Many people do not use other services like pickup" justifying a $1 per package charge, where I would say, what is the point of a mail drop address if you don't get shipments there, and if there was a way to get my packages without 'picking them up' to avoid an extra fee then please enlighten me.  If I get an address at UPS Store  for example, they don't have a 'pickup' change. They would expect, as most would, you would get shipments in, that is obvious.My main point is the deceptive way this charge is applied. After searching for 15 minutes on the iPostal1 site, I finally found this verbiage, "Some locations charge a small pickup fee." Well nice to know now, I already paid a year in advance. I didn't know this when I signed up.  Which locations? Tell me so I can avoid those. Small pickup fee?  How small? It seems they can charge what they want, because I don't know in advance what the fee is going to be.  How am I supposed to make an informed decision?  I have been with the service for less than two weeks, so there is a hidden, secret way to get out of this, please let me know - this is really a deception."Details on pickup fees are available by each address listing."  You will not see these details unless you click on a greyed-out button; important cost details are hidden when they do not need to be hidden, it's literally two lines of text which takes up the same space as the greyed-out 'More Details' button.

Review.Titre: They will charge your card way in…
Review.Contenu: They will charge your card way in advance and refuse to reverse it if you no longer want the service. They also submit false records if you charge back through your credit card. I just got charged $99.00 for an account that no longer even exists.I submitted all of those forms years ago. I’ve been a customer for many years. I had an account, I cancelled it, you just charged me a $99 renewal fee, I protested the $99 renewal fee through my credit card company, and you sent me an email telling me you were deleting my account because I protested the credit card fee. You then told my credit card company that you get to keep the renewal fee you just charged me even though you sent me an email telling me you were cancelling the account.

POOR TRAINING MAYBE AS THE FISH ROTS FROM THE HEADThis company closed my account because of my " colorful language" instead of their incompetence and never refunded the package I paid for and the remaining days on my account. These are crooks and liars IMO. I have decided to file with OMBUDSMEN SERVICES

Review.Titre: unacceptable
Review.Contenu: This services is being advertised for those who have small business' and starting out.  I began my process in February however due to an internal issue I have missed out on contracts, services, checks returned etc.  This is complete unacceptable.  If had not paid for the year and changed my address on DnB I would take my services elsewhere.

Review.Titre: Beware hidden fees & bad customer service
Review.Contenu: After I opened a mailbox, I was charged a $3.00+tax fee to pickup a small envelope package and this fee was not listed on that location’s fee list as a fee I could be charged. And the location just said “No refunds”, wouldn’t address the fact that this fee was hidden, blamed it on ipostal1, despite the charge identifying them. So, I closed my account soon after. With these hidden fees, the cost of renting a ipostal1 box is much higher than renting a PO Box at USPS. More expensive and ridiculously unpredictable. I don’t recommend👎🏻

Review.Titre: Trash Service, No No Nice Way To Say It
Review.Contenu: See my Google review. This is not a small customer shop. It is a $5.1 million business that hasn't figured out even the basics of how to run its operations. The price that they advertise is not the price that you will pay, period. There is up-charges, after up-charge after up-charge, starting with the notarization to the charge for picking up each individual package. Before you even get to that point, if you ever do, do not e Otto be able to use their services for at least one month, absolutely one month at the very minimum from the date that they charge you to start using their service. It is a scam company with completely inept people at the helm.

Review.Titre: Messy and usual lose your mail
Review.Contenu: I have an Ipostal account at San Francisco 730 Noor Ave. At staples. They are a complete mess, they usually loss mail, and when you try to figure out where is your mail with them they have a less then acceptable customer service. Don’t loose your time with them. They are certain headache.

Review.Titre: Mail returned, we couldn't use ipostal1 for a month due to approval delay on their end
Review.Contenu: We couldn't use iPostal for a month due to an approval process on their end, and we still had to pay for that month even though important mail was returned. I filled out the required Form 1583 on Aug. 16, had it notarized through their recommended Notarize service, and submitted through iPostal's channel. More than a month later I discovered that my mail had been returned to sender. My form had never been approved and nobody contacted us. After I contacted them on Sept. 20 they requested my wife fill out a form 1583 as well as a secondary recipient. They claimed that the lack of my wife's form was the reason for the delay, even though I as a primary mail recipient had filled out the form more than a month in advance and it was never approved by them. We missed out on important information, and I can't believe that no one from Ipostal1 contacted us about the issue until I brought it up, nor did they offer to reimburse us for the month we paid in which they did not approve my documents. It took several phone calls and e-mails to clear up this issue even though I followed their instructions to the letter.

Review.Titre: It was very difficult to use and…
Review.Contenu: It was very difficult to use and understand.  Documents did not upload easily and I had to get on a chat and spend a ton of time gaining clarification.

Review.Titre: iPostal lost important mail (IRS), and no answers!
Review.Contenu: iPostal lost important mail from the IRS. After 10 days of chats, I have still have NOT received a note, a courtesy call, or an email in regards to the issue from corporate personnel. Just my chat transcripts and assurances from very helpful and powerless chat persons. I would NOT RECOMMEND THIS SERVICE!!REPLY to comment: INCORRECT, customer service has NOT been in touch me, it has me contacting them repeatedly.

Review.Titre: Your service is great and customer only…
Review.Contenu: Your service is great and customer service only told in big print $9.99 per month for 30 letters or packages No one has in big print that customer pays mail center money every time he drives all the way there to pick up 1 envelope Not only does the customer waste $ in fuel then pays to pick up the 1 envelope Other than that I think the service is a good concept and better than say a ups store mail box rental if a person gets very very little mail like I do.

Review.Titre: Cost of shipping estimate given on the…
Review.Contenu: Cost of shipping estimate given on the website before the membership is taken are not real. The cost of shipping is actually 3 times the amount offered. Extremely excessive shipping cost for location. More than $111 cost of shipping for some shoes that only weight 4 pounds. When asked for quote and online through USPS it’s only $54.70. Unbelievable. I was robbed.

Review.Titre: They don’t return calls
Review.Contenu: I sent in the forms to set up my account almost immediately. I reached out to customer service online because I kept receiving an error message stating that I hadn’t sent in the forms. The rep advised that I needed to call the location to have them expedite uploading the docs. I called and left a message, no response. I called again, nothing. They finally uploaded them but in both messages I did ask someone to return my call. I already paid for a full year or I’d cancel the service.

Review.Titre: This really sucks
Review.Contenu: There’s no physical mail box and staple’s employee has to dig around the packages to find one’s package.Furthermore, I’m already paying for the mail box or space but I got charged for receiving a package.This is ridiculous!

Review.Titre: No customer service!
Review.Contenu: My requests have gone either unanswered or extremely slow at being answered. I've been requesting for them to update my email address for over 2 months and they still haven't nor do they alot any changes online.

Review.Titre: I can't receive any mail and no one has…
Review.Contenu: I can't receive any mail and no one has any idea what is going on they promise to get back to me but never do. Its been 2 months we are behind on bill payments now.We will create a ticket they say....They responded to this Aug 22 saying someone would reach out and of course no call again..

Review.Titre: Filled out the paperwork Thursday…
Review.Contenu: Filled out the paperwork Thursday evening and PAID, PAID again for notary service. AUTOMATED email told me it would take 24 hours to activate. I have gotten nothing within the time period advised, and the company does not have customer service on weekends.

Review.Titre: Terrible customer service
Review.Contenu: Terrible customer service. Reached out for a refund and they said my bank couldn't accept the refund because they were sending in USD and my bank account is in EGP. Sent them my USD bank account and they literally ghosted me. Not recommended.

Review.Titre: Watch credit card charges carefully
Review.Contenu: The process for picking up your mail is very inconvenient.reaching customer service is almost impossible.  Also, my second box was UNAPPROVED from Feb-May however, I was charged $9.99 for that time and was told only the last charge will be refunded. Pay attention to the charges on your card with this company.

Review.Titre: Ignore request with mail
Review.Contenu: I had called and email various times for mail to be rejected as per the advice of the seller. Service completely decided to ignore and now I have to pay per day that the mail is kept. Incredibly bad service!

Review.Titre: My package was delivered on 5/3/2023…
Review.Contenu: My package was delivered on 5/3/2023 with confirmation from USPS however when I went to Staples, I was told that I would have to wait until someone went to the mailbox outside to get the package or until the post man brought in the packages. I followed up the next day and I was told they were understaffed and my package as still in the box. I was finally able to get my package on 5/5/2023.

Review.Titre: The sign-up process was smooth and took…
Review.Contenu: The sign-up process was smooth and took about an hour. In January I received my confirmation email with the postal address with my mailbox number. I used the address provided but never received my mail. After multiple phone calls over the past three months, I was informed on April 25th that information was missing from my confirmation email. The building I selected had a suite number and it was not noted in the confirmation email or in the portal, causing me to lose wages, not receive products, and have missed opportunities. I am awaiting a response from management at Ipostal about the issue. This has yet to be resolved. I will provide an update once I receive a response from management.

Review.Titre: I've genuinely had nothing but issues…
Review.Contenu: I've genuinely had nothing but issues with this service, with the assigned Staples location, with the employees at the location who have no idea what they're doing or how to sort/receive mail. It's been A W F U L.

Review.Titre: I wish I could leave zero stars
Review.Contenu: I wish I could leave zero stars. I requested a piece of mail be shipped to me OVER a month ago. They then shipped me 2 items that I requested to be discarded long before that. I never received my requested item and I have been in touch with various members of their team over the last month, yet NOTHING has been done. I still have not received my item and I continue to get false promise after false promise that it will be resolved, or that someone will contact me, and they never do. It's absolutely disgusting. Their service and follow-through is non existent. DO NOT use this company. They will lose your mail, and never take accountability or rectify the situation.  TERRIBLE company.

Review.Titre: Not Business Class
Review.Contenu: This just isn't meant for more than a solo entrepreneur. This breaks when more than one person needs to use it. Much of the marketing isn't accurate. We have had trouble using it as a real address for our business and they have failed to sign for packages.

Review.Titre: DONT DO IT !
Review.Contenu: It was not made clear that I would be charged for every letter to be opened then charged an additional fee for the item to be shredded.  This service is a money grab in my opinion.  I'm closing my account and would no recommend to anyone, unless you just have money to throw away.  Work on being ethical with upfront information about your services and fees.

Review.Titre: unacceptable
Review.Contenu: unacceptable, the services they offer are not real.  They do not receive correspondence from amazon or google.  He caused us damage, - 5 stars

Review.Titre: I would give 0 if possible
Review.Contenu: I would give 0 if possibleWhen i want a letter forwarded and pay 15$ for express. It should not take 5 business days to get the letter.No money back everyone is blaming someone else.Worst company on earthAlways the carrier NO!I requested shipment Sunday 03/12 business closed OKMonday nothingTuesday nothingWednesday 507pm again PM 507 shipment was created... to LateThursday USPS picked up and delivered FridayBullhead Print and Ship blame iPostal1 iPostal1 support blame USPSAnd now iPostel1 is blaming me:ipostal1.com has flagged your review because they don’t think it’s based on a genuine experience. To keep your review online, we need to ask for your help.You shouldn't treat customers like that

Review.Titre: AVOID!!
Review.Contenu: AVOID!!! I received some documents at my virtual address and I requested them to be forwarded to me. The cost of this was $65.40 which is relatively high just for some documents but I still went ahead. The next day, I got charged $114.46! The customer service doesn't seem to be bothered at all and won't refund the difference. They will the runaround and ask you to contact the mailing centre and the mailing centre will ask you to contact iPostal.

Review.Titre: Absolutely terrible service from the…
Review.Contenu: Absolutely terrible service from the day I subscribed. And wasting a huge amount of time getting my account established, I now find that my mail center is closing. Hopeless!

Review.Titre: Stay away
Review.Contenu: These guys are a complete joke. Almost every single time I want to forward my mail or have something outside of a scan done, they have some kind of issue. Paypal won't work, auto-charge doesn't happen, and credit card gets declined even though it is just fine. Random charges on my credit card, scans are horrible in quality. The website is absolute trash. The app is worse. I don't know how they are still in business. Support is trash.

Review.Titre: Under staffed
Review.Contenu: Under staffed. I had to go into the mail locations to check if my mail arrived. Location is just starting to process a month old mail. Feel I should have received more mail but never received. Having mailer to resend all bills again.

Review.Titre: A very honest and constructive feedback
Review.Contenu: A very honest and constructive feedback1. I initiated one year contract based on feedback. When my first mail didn't make it to your mailbox, I initiated chat support. They asked me to contact the mailbox saying they just connect mailboxes. If you had clearly stated that on your website, very few would begin a contract. We are busy people who do not have time for two-step follow-up for issues that seem to not have been there in the first plae.2. I spent $22 dollars to redirect my global entry which was time sensitive. The mailbox support was not able to tell me why it was not scanned for 6 days. I am concerned with how much time you all take to scan the mails once received.

Review.Titre: I tried to go back and change the name…
Review.Contenu: I tried to go back and change the name on the account. I thought I canceled it. I created a 2nd account which I tried to cancel because I wanted to return to the 1st one, so I sent an email asking for it to be reinstated. My mistake cost me dupe account charges, for which iPostal1 holds me accountable. I discovered the changes went back to March, so that's the money I wasted trying to use your service.

Review.Titre: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE
Review.Contenu: They refused to give me a package that was delivered to them for me.  Joe Cabral in Camarillo office who claimed he was a manager and refused to give me the name of the owner, told me they can't give me the package because the person who delivered it was not wearing a uniform.  While I am standing there, he then gives it to the mail carrier who walks out with it.  I had to follow the mail carrier and pay $10.05 for a package that Ipostal1 says is part of their service.  Virtual Business it says on their website.  "We accept packages from any carrier."  It says.  If I had not heard back from my client that they  were told the package would be returned to sender, I would not have even known that they were refusing packages.  I called Ipostal1's complaint line and a very nice lady apologized and said that should not have happened and she would transfer my account to a different location. Yet, this morning, I get an email that my account has been cancelled!  No refund either!  When I called today, I am told someone will have to call me back!  If you want peace of mind and to have a nice day each day you run your business, DO NOT SIGN UP WITH THIS COMPANY!  Horrible experience and I am a new customer.

Review.Titre: Stole my money and refund
Review.Contenu: Requested a refund on 5/20. Wad told it was sent. today 5/28 they told me my bank declied it bc i had my debit card replaced because i lost it. I tried to give them my new debit card amd they will only refund to original payment method.So I am now out money for a service I never used. I have also filed with bbb, ftc and plan on doing a chargeback since they think its okay to steal from customers.

Review.Titre: Three packages were lost
Review.Contenu: Three packages were lost, I have FedEx tracking proof of delivery and iPostal1 can't find any of them, they claim they were never delivered, however, they charged me for a forwarded package that doesn't exist and they have no proof they send me anything,,, aside from the email from their management with a UPS tracking number.They're a joke, keep looking

Review.Titre: I purchased the virtual address/mailbox…
Review.Contenu: I purchased the virtual address/mailbox plan on 2/19 followed by getting the necessary documents being signed and notarized. Contacted Ipostal due to a message being reflected once I sign in that displayed "will be ready to go in 1-3" once approvals however, the 1-3 days never came as I am still pending a response from Ipostal 12 days later. I've requested a full refund $25 for notary and $9.99 for the monthly service because the lack of help and response. I do not recommend this company and I may be out of $35 dollars along with Ipostal having my personal documents used to sign-up. I would not trust this company if you're thinking about using them!!

Review.Titre: My mail sat in the backroom for a week…
Review.Contenu: My mail sat in the backroom for a week and a half.  I was expecting a very important letter and package from a customer. I called every other day they stated they didn't have anything.  After getting a tracking number from the customer I found out it was delivered a week in a half ago.  Spoke with a manager and they stated they had people out and the none of the mail was checked. Unacceptable.  Hope things get better moving forward.

Review.Titre: Poor service
Review.Contenu: Sign up thru local mail shop with this. They lost my mail after couple months of service. I requested couple months service free make up the inconvenience that caused me. They drag their feet after a month I canceled the account end the ordeal with them. Not recommended.

Review.Titre: I subscribed to the service so that I…
Review.Contenu: I subscribed to the service so that I could receive my mail remotely and in PDF form. Instead of opening my mail and scanning it to me, I received a scanned copy of the envelope. I can get that for free from the united Postal Service. I’m very disappointed and if I can’t figure out a way to resolve this with the company, I will be stopping my service immediately.

Review.Titre: It too two months to approve my mailbox…
Review.Contenu: It too two months to approve my mailbox yet they still charged me. then when I was finally able to pick up my mail I waited for for 20 minutes for someone to take their sweet time doing other things and sorting through a stack of hundreds of pieces of mail for my TWO items that I've been needing for my business for nearly two weeks. then they had the nerve to charge me just to pick it up lol....HORRIBLE and I'm canceling

Review.Titre: I went to pick up my mail and no one…
Review.Contenu: I went to pick up my mail and no one was there. The door was locked at my scheduled time. I’m very upset. It wasn’t outside normal business hours. I received an email Saturday morning 7/15 and I scheduled a time 12:45 pm pickup time, in which they do not close until 2 pm. When I went back on the website to confirm that their reply is not relevant, I saw that they changed my time somehow to 6:30 pm which was not the original time I had chosen. This was changed because I complained and left a review. Please do not insult my intelligence that way ipostal.

Review.Titre: They lost a letter I saw in my mailbox
Review.Contenu: They lost a letter I saw in my mailbox.  Impossible to get a human on the phone.  Chat took 1 hour to agree the letter was lost and open a ticket to find it.  Was supposed to get status in 2 days, it's been a week and just got an email saying they will look into it and I should hear back in 2 days.  If they hired more agents and paid them a better wage it wouldn't be so hard to get things resolved.  It's not the fault of the reps, but of management that isn't managing.

Review.Titre: No satisfaction with IPOSTAL.
Review.Contenu: My husband and I joined ipostal. We went from filling out the necessary paperwork to return 3 different to insure the system. A month later we have not heard from ipostal. My husband had to call around to find out what was going on. So, in addition to joining ipostal, we had to work out with the USPS which is costing us an additional 600.00 dollars to receive our mail. So, you should not use this program. Just use USPS. IPOSTAL is just adding an additional cost.

Review.Titre: First time picking up a package at…
Review.Contenu: First time picking up a package at Staples in San Bruno, CA and they lost it. I use this as a business address. Not very impressed to use iPostal for my business if packages are going to be lost. The Staples Store was chaotic and disorganized. An employee told me if they don’t have it, the package was never sent. I had the USPS tracking number stating the package was delivered to the store. Not impressed.

Review.Titre: After I completion of my notarized …
Review.Contenu: After I completion of my notarized  documents they set in my account for many days with out being processed.  As a result my documents / mail was sent back. I got a notication I  had mail  and it is someone else's mail not mine. Didn't   process my sign up documents in a timely manner. You sent back my mail.  You gave me someone else's mail. Someone else  mail is still in my mailbox.

Review.Titre: The address changed
Review.Contenu: The address changed! The purpose of getting this for me was to have a stable address for providers. Now I have to do another address change. And I just received a mail notice of something that wasn’t remotely addressed to me. I’m frustrated that I paid for a year for a completely useless service.

Review.Titre: I was charged for a scheduled pickup…
Review.Contenu: I was charged for a scheduled pickup for a piece of mail that was not even addressed to me, but the former box holder. Also it took over a week for the location to approve my USPS paperwork.

Review.Titre: Terrible service
Review.Contenu: Terrible service. Im still having problems 3 months later. Stuff just gets lost thats sent there. Its uncanny how not being able to receive mail is pretty crucial to running a small business. I am not happy with this service at all

Review.Titre: I scheduled to pick up my package at… Store closed
Review.Contenu: I scheduled to pick up my package at 7pm. I arrived at the store to find it closed. I was told by a store owner the postal store closes at 5pm daily. So, if that’s the case why have a pickup times after 5pm. I received an email on 5/30 that my Flatbush address is changing to a Broadway address. No date was given for the change to the new location. Why, pick a new location for me ? Broadway is too far for me to pick up my packages. I paid for convenience not inconvenience.

Review.Titre: I have mail and unsure how to receive…
Review.Contenu: I have mail and unsure how to receive my mails.Went to where mailbox is located and could not find where mailbox is located.

Review.Titre: The worst. Avoid.
Review.Contenu: Went back and forth through chat for days about a package that was supposed to arrive weeks ago.Had it forwarded to my address, and instead they shipped it back to the sender's address.Complete waste of money.

Review.Titre: I have been using iPostal1 for over a…
Review.Contenu: I have been using iPostal1 for over a year now, never really had an problems until today when apparently an imposter called iPostal1 to cancel my account. I received an email saying my account was cancelled and I never requested cancellation. This just showed me how easy it was for somebody to get access to your account. The security of iPostal1 account is really vulnerable anybody can call iPostal1 claiming they are you and without verification can access your account in my case cancel your account without verification. If you care about secured mail this is not it

Review.Titre: Not loving this service
Review.Contenu: Not loving this service.  Particularly the hidden fees ($1 to pick up my own mail, that I'm already paying to have delivered?).  Also, the address line is so long, the IRS can't fit it in their data base field.  I'm on the phone with them now trying to fix that.

Review.Titre: Lack of Transparency on Fees...
Review.Contenu: I've been using this service for a little while now. But in the last three months I've noticed a lack of transparency across their services or unclear pricing even after I selected the rate to forward my mail.I'm getting charged double or three times the rate I selected to include service fee. I'd thought iPostal1.com was competitive and transparent in this industry as advertised. Instead they started charging my account crazy fees without disclosure in any invoice.I was charged $21 to forward a 3 pounds package to a US domestic address using USPS. I was charged after I selected the rate to ship the package. It wasn't an international address...Nonsense!I hope they can start disclosing Clear Pricing and total cost w/ rates before charging my account. A breakdown invoice should be disclosed before authorization.I did send an email to support about this issues, no answer at this point. It was more than one occasion where hidden fees were charged AFTER I selected the forwarding rate(below $10.00). As per your request here is one of the transactions numbers: M10981 Invoice 15658464 under druiz. I did email support via the contact us page without an answer. Next time you decide to flag your own customers answer your customers emails looking for support. I'm reducing this review to 1 star due to your lack of ethic to responds my emails and for trying to flag my review instead of taking responsibility for your service.

Review.Titre: Sketchy Service
Review.Contenu: I have not received notice of any mail after six months, customer service is poor and non-responsive, and the mail site is hard to reach (busy line after repeated attempts to call).

Review.Titre: The scanned mails only showed parts of…
Review.Contenu: The scanned mails only showed parts of the letters received and I contacted the customer service. No one replied after multiple attempts.  Also, I’m no longer getting mails through the address, but I’m sure that many mails were sent to the address.  I’d like someone to reach out to me..

Review.Titre: This better be a mistake
Review.Contenu: I have been paying them for a year or two, in preparation for an extended away from home.  Until today, I only received average one letter every 3 months or so.  They made mistakes before, but no big deal, no one perfect.  But I can't believe what's happening today.  I left town a week ago.  I saw a notification email today.  Signed on and noticed there was another mail that had been sitting there for the last 10 days.  Had they notified me, I would have picked it up before leaving.  Ok, whatever, I placed an order to have both letters forwarded to me in another state.  Their system said no charge.  I thought that was odd.  Later (after they sent it out in one envelope), I got an email showing almost $17 for the forwarding.  Are you kidding me?  I have to wait to speak with them till tomorrow, but I hope this is a mistake.  I will update this review later.

Review.Titre: I have to schedule a week out in order…
Review.Contenu: I have to schedule a week out in order to pick up my mail. I am always traveling for work and not always on the island (Oahu Hawaii) I have no idea from week to week where I will be. They also charge me $5.00 to pick up my mail every time on top of my monthly fees.I feel completely ripped off and it is super frustrating to have to make a week prior to get me mail.I also am typically an hour away from where the box is located, and I can only pick up the mail after 2:00 pm and before 5:30 pm which means I must sit in horrific traffic. Again, it is very inefficient and more of a pain than I can describe.

Review.Titre: 1) Pedestrian/non-intuitive user…
Review.Contenu: 1) Pedestrian/non-intuitive user interface. 2) No empathy for end user use cases and journey. 3) Would be best to have a guided set-up and send/receive first mail.4) Slow customer care response.

Review.Titre: I knew that I had been mailed an item…
Review.Contenu: I knew that I had been mailed an item on 11/30/23 from a local company. This morning, 12/7/23, I finally called to inquire if i have received any mail yet. They went to look and confirmed that I had and would scan a photo of it to me. It doesn’t take a week for mail to go locally, and I still have not received a pic of it.

Review.Titre: Hidden fees, slow processing time
Review.Contenu: Slow processing time, paid pick-up ($1/package), additional $25+ to notarize the form PS1583 online instead of going to the office. After the form is notarized, it takes ipostal1 1-3 business days to approve it, meaning you can't start using this service the same day you subscribe to it.

Review.Titre: There must be an "ON HOLD" option (!!!)
Review.Contenu: As much as it seems an amazing service, also thanks to the innovative way they have to validate the documents and their fast service, WITHOUT the possibility of putting "on hold" an account the whole service feels like a scam.If I cannot put "on hold" somehow my paying subscription, I will have to spend money and re-do the whole subscription process just to "reactivate" my subsctiption. that is crazy and feels like a scam altogether.I feel there MUST be an option to have an "unactive" account but that still retains the validation process that is time consuming and costly.

Review.Titre: No communication
Review.Contenu: No communication.  Some of the small envelopes never reached.  Perhaps it's my settings but the experience has not been good to fully migrate my company address.

Review.Titre: No one did informed me that my mailbox…
Review.Contenu: No one did informed me that my mailbox was not working all my mail got send back , i sld not be charge for the month of September poor customer services.DID everything i was asked to do please is just poor customer services.

Review.Titre: it took over 2 months for the mailbox…
Review.Contenu: it took over 2 months for the mailbox to work, and I never received one of the 2 test letters I sent (and the mailbox is only a few blocks from me)edit based on response: I did not file a change of address, and by 'receive' I was referring to notifications within the platform. i finally received the scanned test letters on 10.2.2023 - extremely late

Review.Titre: Charged for everything, even incorrectly filed mail
Review.Contenu: Mail is incorrectly placed in my mailbox quite often and there is no method within the app for the user to remove the mail other than sending an email or making a phone call to ipostal1. If you forget, you get charged for mail that is not even yours. Between this continued frustration and their increased nickel and diming for every action, it is time to find a better mail service.

Review.Titre: The most convoluted sign up process i…
Review.Contenu: The most convoluted sign up process I have experienced. Paid $50 to Notarize Online to expedite things and I still had to make six phone calls and upload documents multiple times. I start my experience as a client with the feeling the whole thing is very clunky and inefficient. And I could have saved $50 by getting a Notary myself and uploading the documents. Customer care pretty clueless.UPDATE after reply:I know Form 583 is a USPS requirement. That is not my issue.

Review.Titre: Unclear Fees and Costs
Review.Contenu: I was surprised to find out about a $1 package pickup fee, as this was not something that is communicated clearly when you sign up for this service. I only realized this after I checked my bank and saw a pending charge. No prior authorization was required for it either, which also irritated me. We don’t typically receive packages in the mail, so I’m really dreading when we do now. I chose iPostal because it was cheaper than a USPS box, but after the uncharges, it’s actually not.

Review.Titre: Pay attention to your account
Review.Contenu: Pay attention to your account. Fees get charged to you - even after you’ve cleaned out your mailbox. This service is advertised as $9.99 or whatever price per month, but there always seems to be an additional charge for something. There is a customer service number to call but no one ever picks up. The only way to contact them is through email and it will take them a week or so to respond back to you.

Review.Titre: Increased postal rates make it hard to use this service
Review.Contenu: I have maintained this service for years however the recent massive increases in postal rates have become inhibitive for people like me who maintain this service for US to Canada forwarding.In a recent experience I paid over $80 USD in USPS postal charges, in order to forward a $20 small bottle of mint mouth fresheners (less than 0.1 lb in weight and small dimensions). I was told that this was my lowest cost option.

Review.Titre: Price is good/ customer service NOT
Review.Contenu: Price is good but customer service is really bad. They don't respond to phone calls (they don't take calls) and it takes days for them to get back to you on the simplest issue, usually with an unhelpful answer. ** they keep saying, they're currently short staffed, but they've used that excuse now for over six months. At some point, it's just about bad business management.

Review.Titre: Rough experience trying to sign up…
Review.Contenu: Horrible experience trying to sign up for this company.  They kept rejecting my credit cards...all of them.  Then their customer service kept pushing me to sign up with PayPal which requires you to spend 2.5x the monthly price to use.  Got the runaround from everyone at this company.  Tread very carefully with this company and beware.Update: Finally got signed up  but took an entire week and a lot of effort.  Also, the notarization had to pushed through as well so not a straightforward process.  I'll update the experience as it progresses.

Review.Titre: I only need an address.
Review.Contenu: They keep asking for my review even though I don't want to leave one so here it is....I only need an address, but they make the process burdensome and annoying, especially for small business owners. They nickel and dime you, never have office space available because they allow people to rent them monthly.  I don't think the service is worth it.  $40+ each month just for the address, $3+ to auto scan letters (even if you do not request this service), $1+ to pick up your letter etc... Hire an attorney to handle your business correspondence, it's cheaper and you have legal representation/privacy.

Review.Titre: All crickets…
Review.Contenu: I have reached out to customer service multiple times regarding the status of some parcels that had received been received and shown as shipped to my PO Box by ups days prior to getting a notification from iPostal1 that I had anything in my PO Box and I never got a response back from customer service I just had to wait and hope that my mail wasn’t missing

Review.Titre: Bad experience so far
Review.Contenu: At first my experience with iPostal1 was good. Mail was scanned and shredded as requested. An then all of the sudden they started canceling my scan requests with excuses that my mail can't be scanned for security reasons. Exactly the same kind of mail that was scanned by them before without any issues. I'm staying overseas for an extended period of time, and signed up with iPostal1 so I can have access to my important time sensitive mail in the USA. They now are refusing to scan it, and they would not ship this mail to my location. I'm very much not happy with the experience so far.

Review.Titre: Customer service is nonexistent
Review.Contenu: Customer service is nonexistent. Phone is always busy and email support takes several days to get a response. After 4 email exchanges over two weeks my account is still not able to receive mail. The store performing the actual mail service (3rd party) told me that they can't do anything and don't know how the accounts work.

Review.Titre: So far I found out that most of the…
Review.Contenu: So far I found out that most of the time my mail isnot delivered on time,also the charges are all the timefor no reason, and extra charges for nothing.There is no control  in order to charge on timefor any mail that you think it is going to be charge.In other words, there is not cronologic way to make\any charges,they do it by wish.

Review.Titre: Overall very unhappy with the service…
Review.Contenu: Overall very unhappy with the service the past year and a half.  I have had issue after issue...mail not sent when requested, charging too much for mailing, charging to consolidate and charging for additional mail in a month.  I have no control over bulk mail.  It is unfortunate that you do not run a better business via Staples.

Review.Titre: They need to be honest and upfront with…
Review.Contenu: They need to be honest and upfront with the service fees. Very misleading advertising. I would not recommend this company to anyone. Just as a specific example their website indicates $2.25 for scan or shred orders. If you have a document scanned its $2.25. Its another $2.25 to have that same document shredded. That's $4.50 to read a single sensitive letter. The monthly service is advertised in BIG BOLD LETTERS $9.99 PER MONTH. I guess that's true if you never get or read your mail, but it doubles if you get/read & dispose of just 2 pieces of mail per month.

Review.Titre: I was testing out getting mail and…
Review.Contenu: I was testing out getting mail and received a small 6"x4" envelope package ✉️ and was very disappointed that I got charged for local pickup.  Be sure to read the fine print, your monthly fee doesn't necessarily mean you can get delivered mail or packages there for free!  After my credit card charge I checked the ipostal website and it says "some places may charge a nominal fee" under local pickup.   Had I known I would be charged $2 a package, I'd probably not signed up for a year!  So now I'll just use it as a business address without the extra fees that I thought my $10 a month was covering!

Review.Titre: Form 1582 process is a hot mess
Review.Contenu: Form 1582 process is a hot mess.  Took over a week to get our mailbox working.  Inconsistent instructions and finger-pointing causing irritating delays in service.  Just got our first piece of mail.  Can't wait to see how bad that experience will be.UPDATE: Note the cardboard, unresponsive "answer" to this post.  That is the kind non-support I got. Also, no notification was sent, they kept flashing the same message as everyone gets while waiting.  Nice try.

Review.Titre: I-postal has a lot of fine print and info that comes after you pay
Review.Contenu: I-postal has a lot of fine print. Some disclosures about how the services work are not delivered until you have paid and get the welcome letter. Many of the "physical" addresses are Staples Stores. No workspace available, just Staples print services. Staff quality depends on the current staff at Staples. Phone Customer Service was horrible. I gave two stars instead of one, because it is a virtual address if that's all you need and the young lady in the store was friendly. I would have changed immediately, but going through the address change involves so much and I need to secure a much better service before changing.

Review.Titre: Tornado disabled my location in April…
Review.Contenu: Tornado disabled my location in April of 2023. I was not notified how I would be receiving my mail. After 5 months of attempting to secure information regarding my account, I was able to reach customer service. I was informed my mail was being held by the post office and I could pick it up there. I don't understand why it took 5 months to track down my mail with no assistance from iPostal1?  With no account services available until September, a refund was not granted. I paid for 12 months service and only received mail service for 6 months with mail being held. I do not recommend this mail forwarding service. iPostal1 does not have a committed customer service ethic. This was a natural disaster that hopefully this company can use to improve their services.Update:  location was Shawnee Oklahoma 2023 at the Staples location on Kickapoo Street.  Exact Tornado date unsure but spring of 2023. I hope this helps in your investigation. Thank you!

Review.Titre: Half the time I request my mail to be…
Review.Contenu: Half the time I request my mail to be sent to my physical address, some mail is missing. I always have to scan and save a pdf before requesting the send just in case. But there have many several unretrievable items that have costed money and time to get copies of from the original sender.

Review.Titre: I was disappointed to learn that I do…
Review.Contenu: I was disappointed to learn that I do not get any scanned letters included. Other services will open the mail and scan the contents without an additional charge as long as it is within the total scans of the month. If I have to consistently go into staples to get my mail to see the contents than the location is not helpful and out of the way.

Review.Titre: I wish I read these reviews before I…
Review.Contenu: I wish I read these reviews before I signed up. The customer service is poor at best and trying to get my mail service set up has been an absolute nightmare. I cannot get anyone to call me back and I have been trying since February when I purchased the mail service to get it set up. I have spent hours going back and forth  trying to just get this set up so I can get my mail, SUPER FRUSTRATING and not to mention the income and business I have lost because of this experience.

Review.Titre: False promise
Review.Contenu: They promise a true street address, but the real address has PO BOX on it; most companies and people do not accept it (False promise) They are only a platform and do not stand behind the product; you better rent a PO Box directly with the store that offers it.

Review.Titre: The instructions were blurred.
Review.Contenu: The instructions were blurred. I was always confused. The local post office was lot much help. Really bad experience. Want to cancel. Truely not the best solution to my mail issues.

Review.Titre: Awful website and process
Review.Contenu: Customer service was helpful but the system and process is abysmal. Took eight days to process my form. Even after that I had to remind them to send it to the mail center. I ended up missing an important delivery.Just a terrible experience so far.

Review.Titre: There's always confusion and…
Review.Contenu: There's always confusion and uncertainty around when/whether I will received my mail or package. Prior to each visit I'd receive confirmation of a package delivered to my mailbox. Once I arrive at the location to pick it up. The associates always have trouble confirming/finding my package. It's always stressful. But I love the convenience of having this service. So I unfortunately accept this poor feature of it.

Review.Titre: Not sure I picked the right service
Review.Contenu: Signed up for Staples, sent test mail, never notified of receipt of mail I sent to test. When I spoke to your representative to change location, he never told me that the new address was double in price.

Review.Titre: The app seems nice enough but so far i…
Review.Contenu: The app seems nice enough but so far i have had four packages delivered, and a week on, only one of them has registered in the app, and i called the physical carrier and pestered them about it. The whole point of getting this mailbox was so that I didn't have to babysit my mail and it'd show up automatically. Wondering why I don't just get a PO box.

Review.Titre: I had the iPostal plan for two months…
Review.Contenu: I had the iPostal plan for two months and did not receive any mail.  I called Staples several times to find out and they would not return my calls and could never give me a straight answer. Finally I had to contact iPostal to have them communicate with Staples to get feedback and resolution.  I would prefer to deal with smaller mail box storefronts rather than Staples.  Big box stores don’t seem to put much value on customer care.

Review.Titre: When I go pickup they always have…
Review.Contenu: When I go pickup they always have trouble locating my packages. Or they leave they out in open where I grab my own package just because I know it was mine they had no idea who I was. They never can find the keys to open just not organized.

Review.Titre: iPostal1 contractor doesn't charge the…
Review.Contenu: iPostal1 contractor doesn't charge the rates he advertised.  Additionally he will charge to refuse packages even though I never authorized this.  There might be better contractors, but iPostal1 doesn't police the people it contracts with.

Review.Titre: I had an important letter that I…
Review.Contenu: I had an important letter that I requested be mailed to me. It took 8 days for it to be sent out. By the time it arrived we had left that location. Staples said they didn’t get the queue for it to be sent out until a day or two prior to mailing. So, I called Ipostal Support. Support never answers and always keeps me on hold for several minutes. The recording states they be answering soon but it inevitably it goes to voicemail. They promise to call back. It’s been over a week. I still haven’t been contacted. In the past if they do follow up its by email and it takes forever. In my experience, the mail center blames Ipostal, Ipostal blames the mail center. Nothing gets resolved.

Review.Titre: iPostal1 started charging me monthly…
Review.Contenu: iPostal1 started charging me monthly fees even before the account was activated, pending documents approval. Hence I paid monthly fees and no mail could be sent to me but I still have to pay the fee due. Very strange business practice!

Review.Titre: Not that great of a service as I thought
Review.Contenu: Received mail and requested it be forwarded to me. Which costs a couple dollars a letter, on top of monthly fee. It didn't get sent and I requested it sent again. It caught up, but the service does not seem worth it unless you live close to your mailbox. It only seems useful for junk mail. To use it for regular important mail, home address seems to be better. You should get a couple free a month imo. Post office box may be a better option

Review.Titre: One time they lost my mail
Review.Contenu: One time they lost my mail. Almost every time, I have to wait 5-15 minutes for them to find it. Once, they said it wasn't there and then another staff member went back and found it (the first person overlooked it). I use the service because I am not aware of a reasonably priced alternative.

Review.Titre: The website and app are terrible when…
Review.Contenu: The website and app are terrible when it comes to managing the actual settings.  I was trying to add a person to my mail box and there is no link to do so.  The "help" merely states that you can add 4 people but no instructions on how to do it nor a link to where you can do it.

Review.Titre: Punctuality "Counts!"
Review.Contenu: As you van see, the notification punctuality, was delayed more than 24hrs. This is not professional communication. The package was opened when I wen to sign for it. The agent, stated as such, this is the way they received it. The notification, process should be quite electronic and simple. This requires improvement.

Review.Titre: lack of communication
Review.Contenu: The service and the location aren’t communicating. I show 1 charge on the app and the location charges something else. Each time I pick up I have a problem. I’ve only had it for 2 months the 1st time I was unable to schedule pickup on the app, so I emailed the location to pick up- showed up and they wouldn’t release my mail.

Review.Titre: Don’t recommend at all
Review.Contenu: Don’t recommend at all, had this service for a year now, about 20-50% of my packages are lost or stolen, and about 50-80% of my mail is lost, stolen, and returned to sender. All the thin envelopes and junk mail shows up, but any envelopes that contain anything a little thick like credit cards, gift cards etc always get stolen. Anything that the size or packaging suggests that something inside is something of value, it gets stolen. Use of the tracking numbers shows successful deliveries are made, but they get mysteriously misplaced after that. If you’re thinking about signing up for this address iPostal service, just don’t. There’s no security for any of your mail, just use another service!

Review.Titre: The stores that sign up for iPostal…
Review.Contenu: The stores that sign up for iPostal aren't usually familiar with the process. The employees scramble to look for pkgs/ mail. There is usually one person who is familiar with how iPostal works.

Review.Titre: iPostal1 can make your life easier if they wanted…
Review.Contenu: Ipostal1 and Staples are separate entity..opening a digital mailbox at Ipostal1 doesn’t mean you can start receiving mail at the Staples mailbox…There was a discrepancy between Ipostal1 and Staples as far as meeting the requirement for completing the Form1583..Submitted a government ID and a State Drivers License for the notarization….Kept waiting for the Form 1583 approval for almost a week, but didn’t hear back from Staples…Wrote an email but no response and after calling was told the government ID had to have a signature on it to be valid….On the ipostal1 site Photo ID just needed a photo no mentioning of signature but according to Staples, ID provided must have signature.. and nobody bothered to call us or send us an email to tell us…Also I used Notary.com provided by iPostal1 to prepare the Form 1583 and was assured by the Notary that the 2 IDs used were acceptable…I hate when they give you the runaround…

Review.Titre: I was able to pick up my mail
Review.Contenu: One time they lost my mail. Almost every time, I have to wait 5-15 minutes for them to find it. Once, they said it wasn't there and then another staff member went back and found it (the first person overlooked it). I use the service because I am not aware of a reasonably priced alternative.

Review.Titre: 1Long address 2 can’t forward mail from…
Review.Contenu: 1Long address 2 can’t forward mail from usps 3you have to pay to scan pick on top of paying monthly 4 overall feels completely wrong

Review.Titre: I received packages 2 days ago
Review.Contenu: I received packages 2 days ago . Was not scanned in, if it wasn’t for the brand sending me a tracking number and emailing me to confirm if I received I wouldn’t have know that I had packages there. The scan in / picture on the app is 1 of the main reasons I chose your company.

Review.Titre: No notice when package arrives
Review.Contenu: They are supposed to send an email when a package arrives and out of the 2 packages that have come I have not been notified.

Review.Titre: Too long for the local Staples to…
Review.Contenu: Too long for the local Staples to approve our documents.  Went right up to the wire on the 3 day window.  Impossible for us to get documents to them any sooner since we were out of the country when the service was set up...and then were leaving again on the 15th.  So, a package was returned to sender on the 17th (March) and mail from that same day was not scanned until the 20th...so, you tell me, should I be upset?  Of course, I am upset with the service at this point.  BTW, the notary service said we didn't need documents for the second person on the form...just the primary...

Review.Titre: high fees…
Review.Contenu: The charges for the varying services that you provide are excessive and non-ending. I don't think I'll be a customer of this service for long the costs are to high.

Review.Titre: Not thrilled kinda disappointed actually
Review.Contenu: For the second time I have been charged for mail I already picked up as well as mail was supposed to be discarded and was not. Missing mail this week, lucky wasn't important.

Review.Titre: I do not like that I am charged storage…
Review.Contenu: I do not like that I am charged storage fees on top of a recurring monthly bill. I pay for a mailbox knowing that my mail is safe until I can pick it up. The extra fees are ridiculous.

Review.Titre: Package lost by iPostal1 Employee
Review.Contenu: Package was tracked via USPS and delivered to the iPostal1 location. The employees were then unable to find the package for the next 4 days when it was finally discovered.

Review.Titre: Your screening process for ID verification is too picky.
Review.Contenu: Your screening process for ID verification is too picky. I sent ID's and they were too blurry even though on my end they were perfect. I sent the second set of ID's and that wasn't good enough. I sent the post office form, and you didn't like that either, so I had to send it again. We almost quit your service.

Review.Titre: I’m surprised I have to pay a monthly…
Review.Contenu: I’m surprised I have to pay a monthly subscription AND the first scanned items are so expensive.  I feel tricked
