Review.Titre: Virtual mailbox bills for each item you…
Review.Contenu: Virtual mailbox bills for each item you receive. Operation hours suck because they don’t open early or stay open late.l, which is a conflict for working folks.

Review.Titre: Very poor instructions on how too set…
Review.Contenu: Very poor instructions on how too set up the account. I think it is very poor and that they need to improve there customer service.

Review.Titre: Limited communication.
Review.Contenu: Communication is limited between customer and the client. There should be a voice mail to retrieve messages from.

Review.Titre: Not all locations have trained employees
Review.Contenu: 1. In the setup of our service with iPostal1, we took our signed and notarized Form 1583 and our IDs to the store where the employee took it and spent time on his computer, then returned and said we were all set up.Later that day we logged into the iPostal1 app only to find we were not set up, that we had not submitted the required  documents. During an online chat with iPostal1, we were told that the store was not set up to approve our documents, that we would have to send them to iPostal1 and they would  in turn, forward them to the main Staples for approval and it would take up to 3 days. We did what they said to do and do now have an account properly set up with them.2. Two packages arrived at the Staples store where iPostal1 is in Sierra Vista, We had tracked them with USPS tracking numbers. Twenty-four hours later we had still not been notified of their arrival. We went to the store, and the employee had to look for the packages in the back where they had not even been processed. They took pictures of the packages, handed them to us, and had us sign for them.Later that day we found a $2.00 charge from iPostal1 for a "Scheduled pickup." We were never informed there would be a charge, and this pickup was definitely not scheduled.We are unhappy with iPostal1 and how this was all handled. They are using a location and employees who are not efficient or capable of properly handling the service for iPostal1.UPDATE: As a response to iPostal1's reply... I have no issue scheduling a pickup. I have a big issue when waiting over 24 hours for the packages to show in my account so I can schedule the pickup. I am still waiting for another package to be entered into the system  Timeliness is everything, especially when a customer has paid for Overnight,  Priority, or Express packages.

Review.Titre: Poor customer service
Review.Contenu: Poor customer service, extremely delayed response times to emails, difficult and invasive to set the account up, limited locations to choose from in our mid sized city, mom and pop shop where mine was located didn’t notify me of mail pieces received, and I could go on and on.

Review.Titre: They overcharge for their services
Review.Contenu: They overcharge for their services.  Also, I’m supposed to be getting mail there under my name.  It’s not coming through

Review.Titre: I have done everything right, nothing is being received
Review.Contenu: I have done everything right, asked for help and got reassurances, but still have not received ANY mail. I'm trying very hard to be patient, but it's frustrating to bring up my issues, get some buttered words, and then be told "well you didn't get any mail." No mail since January?? When I know people had sent me mail??EDIT: 4/7/23 They literally just sent me a message that they finally got ONE piece of mail. lets see if it makes it to me now.EDIT: 4/19/23 I have not gotten the one piece of mail I was notified of and no new mail has been received by them.EDIT: 6/19/23 Still have not received any new mail in my virtual box and I still have not had any mail reach my hands.EDIT: 06/29/23 got mail and PAID for it to make sure it gets to me. I have a service in place where I receive pics of what mail I am receiving that day. The request and payment was 06/26/23. Hope it makes it to me.EDIT: 07/17/23 finally got my mail last week! But I got an extra letter that originally was lost? I won't complain, but it is rather confusing since I was told it was lost. and I checked that I have received 2 more in my virtual mailbox. I believe iPostal1 tried to rectify the past issues by not charging these 2 new letters to be sent to me. I'm still wary about the consistency, but it's appreciated it. I'll update if I receive anything else.EDIT:08/21/23 RE-EDIT:8/22/23 gotten my mail twice in a row now, but I thought the UI was bugging out. Thank you for telling me what was really going on and I appreciate the explanation! So far, I have been happier with my experience and hope I to receive my mail.

Review.Titre: The cost is excessively high.
Review.Contenu: The cost is excessively high.1 letter pick up $11 package pick up $4In 2 weeks and I'm already charge $10/month and $50 for pick up charges!

Review.Titre: Mail notifications are very slow
Review.Contenu: I only receive notifications about new mail received every few weeks.  I thought I would get notified much more often.

Review.Titre: Lack of Customer Service/Support
Review.Contenu: I have had an account with iPostal1 for a number of years. The service started out ok and everything was fine, but the store being used for my address apparently changed hands and things are not so smooth any more. The new owners are less efficient, less conscientious and the employees are not helpful. I have now had call them directly 3 or 4 times with no results.  Had a recent problem with their billing system that should have been cleared up quickly, but it took days to straighten out because the iPostal1 website was not working properly and I was told they have no IT department. The only department that answers the phone is Sales. The only real customer service and support is by 'Chat' as it is extremely difficult to get anyone from iPostal1 'customer service' main office in New York to answer the phone. Even chat usually has a long wait. All this to see one's mail? When I first considered which company to use, I called their main 800 support number and it was fairly easy to reach--good service. Now, iPostal1 only has support from 9am to 5pm EST on weekdays. Many of the customers live internationally so this is a hassle if there is a problem. It seems that the company has gone downhill service-wise in the last year. I read a review that said iPostal1 had great service 24/7! I can only assume the reviewer was confused. Ipostal1 has no 24/7 service service options. Even 'Chat' is only available 9am to 5pm EST on weekdays. I really do not want to have to change my address, but I am now quite nervous about my mail being handled by this company. They do not monitor the stores carefully enough and they do not seem to understand that US mail is very important to customers. A letter scan that I requested 5 days ago still has not been done. For the amount customers pay iPostal1, the service should be much better and their stores should be more efficient. This company will tell you they care about the customers, but they do not act like it.

Review.Titre: Unexpected fees
Review.Contenu: Fees for mail storage even if you pick up your mail, unless you log in and mark it as picked up every single time.

Review.Titre: I have constant issues with mail either…
Review.Contenu: I have constant issues with mail either not being ship at times I request or mail getting lost!  Multiple issues with communication as well!

Review.Titre: We tested the service and decided against it
Review.Contenu: We tested the service.  The UI/UX is poor.  The service clings to every penny citing policy, even it is clear that service was not used.

Review.Titre: I’ve had a bad experience overall with…
Review.Contenu: I’ve had a bad experience overall with you guys. I’ve received my mail opened by you guys. Very unacceptable.

Review.Titre: I feel like they hid the fact that…
Review.Contenu: I feel like they hid the fact that scanning mail costs extra. I was under the impression that it was included

Review.Titre: The system does not update often and…
Review.Contenu: The system does not update often and the knowledge of mail being delivered is notified to be via the united postal service but I don't get a notification of delivery in the mailbox.

Review.Titre: Slow to process and notify of your…
Review.Contenu: Slow to process and notify of your deliveries, unreasonable costs to pick up.  I've elected to go to a competitor.

Review.Titre: Unsatisfactory
Review.Contenu: The iPostal1 location I use originally charged to forward mail, but picking up mail was free. Then they started charging my card for me picking up my mail (after I paid for the membership). I found some charges on my credit card, and then they admitted their policy had changed, although they never notified me to see if I was happy to continue with the new charges.They also require me to schedule a time that I want to pick up, but when I arrive they never have anything ready. So I schedule, then stand around for 10 minutes waiting for them to locate my mail.Once I scheduled, then arrived to collect my mail. I was there for almost half an hour while they looked all over for a missing package. Finally they asked me to come back later to collect it, so they had additional time to locate it. I got in the car and left and they called me 5 minutes later to tell me they finally found it. So I had to drive back and find parking to get it. I’m now paying a friend to receive my mail and cancelling with iPostal1.***Nice that they responded here, but no follow up as promised. Went in to collect my last mail from the physical location and had to stand there wait while the girl was sitting on the computer instead of preparing my scheduled pickup. Goodbye iPostal1.

Review.Titre: It costs $3 just to pick up mail
Review.Contenu: I like all the services and features. I don't like that it costs $3 each time I pick up mail.

Review.Titre: I loved this until I found out they…
Review.Contenu: I loved this until I found out they charge you for picking up your mail

Review.Titre: Terrible communication and misleading rates
Review.Contenu: Asked about rate for shipping an item. Was given a link to refer to to. Link had no rate info and said I had to ask them directly. So, emailed again to ask for rate. Was then given a rate of $3-$4. Asked them to ship item. Was charged $12. Asked why the difference. They said the rate was higher because it was a package and not a letter. They knew it was a package. No apology. No refund. Asked about getting a rate sheet for future. Request declined. Told I had to ask them for the rate each time. Not falling for that again.

Review.Titre: unstable addresses
Review.Contenu: hard to use. unstable addresses. multiple physical address changes with little notice.

Review.Titre: Expensive
Review.Contenu: Insane to charge $2+ every time I need a piece of mail scanned or shredded.

Review.Titre: No communication
Review.Contenu: No communication from company when contacting you by email.

Review.Titre: I did not know every time I picked up…
Review.Contenu: I did not know every time I picked up my mail I will be charged a fee.

Review.Titre: Mail not arriving for several weeks.
Review.Contenu: I have a mailbox at the Chicago location.  I have been calling and emailing the company for days.  No phone response as agents are always busy.  No response to email. Everything worked fine for a couple of months, then suddenly no mail for 3 weeks. I have confirmed with my USPS location that mail is being forwarded.  Customer service is not good.

Review.Titre: Been double charged for mail box for…
Review.Contenu: Been double charged for mail box for almost 2 years.  Not good

Review.Titre: I am having problems…
Review.Contenu: I can not recommend this mail forwarding address used by the iPostal1 service.  I believe the USPS is delivering some letters and packages to the wrong location resulting in lost mail.  UPS and Fedex give me delivery notifications so I know to check with the iPostal1 service and I have not had any lost packages from UPS or FedEx.

Review.Titre: I think the software is great but my service center is awful
Review.Contenu: I think the software is great but my local mail service center UnionpostSF is a disaster. They’ve lost a package. Sent me mail addressed to someone else. And worst of all they don’t respond to emails. I hate to pass this on to iPostal1, because their customer service is actually good, but they should hold these shops accountable. I’m in the process of transitioning to another box shop that I hope will be better.

Review.Titre: Steer clear of virtual PO boxes, and ipostal.
Review.Contenu: It wasn't made clear that an individual needed to either schedule a pickup, or mark item's as "picked up", this had been done by our local merchant for some time, and then stopped.  I was charged fees for things that were picked up, and not stored.  I feel like this is a poorly designed service.

Review.Titre: I must not have read the fine print
Review.Contenu: I must not have read the fine print. I get charged for every piece of mail I pick up. I inquired about this and the response was something to the effect of, each place may or may not charge. I will be using a new service when my contract is over. Which is going to be a huge ordeal. Besides that the service is convenient.

Review.Titre: Not a great system.
Review.Contenu: Not a great system.When you have new mail, you're alerted, but then you have to request to have it scanned for view which takes several days. iPostal1 does not tell you when the scan is complete, so you have to keep logging in repeatedly to manually check this until it's finally ready. Frustrating.

Review.Titre: Works but is very rough around the edges
Review.Contenu: The basic service works as advertised but the mechanics of using the service from the user interface of the website (designed what? in 1995?) plus the quality of the scans (half pages, not always getting both sides) reduce trust in the service. The iOS apps are an unusable disaster as well. As this is a critical service for us we continue to use it and suffer through the poor user experience and customer service. Would be great to see some investment in the way it works.

Review.Titre: Be careful when domiciling business
Review.Contenu: Be careful domiciling a business at one of their higher priced "office building" locations (ones that don't appear as mail drops when searched online in a street maps application): Before paying they give you the address as "XX Street, Suite XX, Town, State, Zip"; After paying they surprise you by requiring the use of a "PMB" in the address (some authorities don't allow a PMB as a domicile).  Also, their web dashboard has poor regard to good human factors design and it won't accept my perfectly valid business debit master card issued by their advertised "perks", "partner" Mercury.  On the other hand, the operations at the specific location I chose (which is a separate business not owned by iPostal1) is quick and efficient.  iPostal1 is what it is until someone does it better.

Review.Titre: Be very careful with the options you…
Review.Contenu: Be very careful with the options you select. It is not clear to new users what options incur additional fees. The local service or iPostal1 won't refund you if you get it wrong. The website should be clearer as to when selected options incur additional fees. I'm still disappointed about this and no one seems to care at the local store or iPostal1. I've already brought it up to them directly but didn't get any response saying they would correct it.

Review.Titre: Poor information on website.
Review.Contenu: Poor information on website.I chose an address which did not charge a penny for pickup but it comes out that for packages larger than 4896cu inches there is only 5 days of free storage. After that you either have to pickup (which it is not my case as I am still in my home country) or pay $1,10 per pound for each 5 extra days in storage.

Review.Titre: Changing Plans Failed!!
Review.Contenu: I chat with Anelise who changed her story about downgrading my account three times. She asked that I "Cancel the account to get a refund." I'm still waiting patiently for that refund. I would not recommend this company based on her responses, good bye!

Review.Titre: Called a few times for assistance and…
Review.Contenu: Called a few times for assistance and they are not very helpful.  Had them consolidate and ship me a package over two weeks ago and still haven’t received it. They make it seem like I’m bothering them each time I call.  I’ll be getting a box at a   U  P  S    store soon.

Review.Titre: lots of extra charges
Review.Contenu: Mobile app interface is terrible. It reminds me of a 1990’s web app. I got the basic plan as a trial but there is no value bc everything is an add on service. Had I realized that I would have used a different service that had a higher monthly fee but more built in services such as mailing my letters to me. On the upside, the local operator is very nice to work with.

Review.Titre: been trying to use their on line notary…
Review.Contenu: been trying to use their on line notary service but neither its web site nor phone app work . customer support only available through email and they take hours to answer always trying to get you to do the same thing that doesn't work . This is a crappy notary service . now I'm out of time and will be charged for trying to use their service that doesn't work . very disappointed but I have all ready changed all my mail to here . Wouldn't recommend this service

Review.Titre: This sounded great in theory
Review.Contenu: This sounded great in theory, but it certainly is not working in practice. Every time I go to pick up my mail it takes 20-30 minutes because nobody seems to know what they are doing. My packages constantly get misplaced, fail to get checked in properly, and fail to get logged as picked up. I spend hours of my time waiting around in the store or on the phone trying to make sure I don't get charged for storage on packages I have already picked up. The staff tend to blame the problems on the computer system or fail altogether to acknowledge how unprofessional the service is. Very disappointed with this experience.

Review.Titre: NYC E 23rd St Location Poor Customer Support
Review.Contenu: I have a  NYC account at 115 E 23rd St. The NYC location sent an email out yesterday, April 14th, stating that pick up mail service would be suspended from April 16th thru April 21st. Pick up by appointment only.  I went there today, April 15th, to pick up my mail, and there is no one available to assist with mail pick up. (Fortunately, I found one of the maintenance staff who was able to assist me.) I was told that the receptionist is on vacation thru next week, so there will be no one available to assist with the mail. This is a poor way to manage a facility. Very disappointing.

Review.Titre: I like that the subscription is cheap…but that's it
Review.Contenu: I like that the subscription is cheap just not happy with facility charging me everytime I get a package and that was not mentioned when I got account....I found out after I had a package pick up, also other buisness that work with ipostal charge if the the size of the package is too big, thats understandable, but to charge me for every piece of mail is ridiculous. So now I have to wait to let mail build up to get at one time to be charged

Review.Titre: Not user
Review.Contenu: The forms are easy to fill out but getting the 2 forms of ID and the notary approval form and the final approval to a long time and many phone calls. My new address was not clear until the final approval. The user tutorial is not very detailed or user-friendly. There are many extra up charges like for shredding mail @ $2.25/piece which I thought were included up to 15 in my package. Forwarding  your mail is a bulk fee. Viewing and deleting is about all that is included for the 14.99 package that I chose.

Review.Titre: They are okay but nothing phenomenal
Review.Contenu: They are okay but nothing phenomenal. The employees don't pay attention to detail. For instance, they scan mail upside down and so you have to correct it. It gets annoying when you have to do something over and over again because they don't care to take a quick second to scan in the mail correctly so that the custmers can see their mail rightside up. If this continues, it is worth going elsewhere because it is something they can fix in a split second.

Review.Titre: Decent but room for improvement.
Review.Contenu: I think the service is wonderfully affordable and the features are useful. However, the interface is slow and inefficient. I think it could be updated into a more modern, intuitive, and straightforward layout. Also, I definitely despise the fact that I can’t add my roommates onto my postal box. I can only add my spouse and kids (who are nonexistent). As long as every boxholder signs an appropriate 1583 form, why does this matter? Physical mailboxes do it all the time.

Review.Titre: Unprofessional Notary and iPostal1 rules caused delays
Review.Contenu: I disliked that I had to wait to receive my US postal mail because I needed to update my request to receive or send international mail. In addition, the notary signed the form to give approval for international mailing and Staples needed me to make a change to the form. What did I pay the notary for? Why was it not corrected before she and I signed the form? It took too long to straighten out this matter.

Review.Titre: It's quite misleading
Review.Contenu: It's quite misleading. You're told you get a certain number of pieces of mail per month for a certain price, then the minute you need to deal with that mail, each item costs even more to shred or scan. That initial 30 pieces or whatever should be inclusive of the monthly price. I understand having an additional cost for forwarding mail, but to scan and shred? That should be made way clearer that your 10 or month is actual going to cost more like 30 or more. Very disappointed.

Review.Titre: Great concept
Review.Contenu: I got my first notification that I had mail since opening this account. Thankfully a photo was sent of the package. The guy manning the area where the ipostal mail was had no idea what he was doing.  The places where the ipostal mail is kept seemed like an afterthought. When the clerk finally opened the cabinet where the package was,  I had to point out the one on top that looked like the photo I was sent.I don't have much confidence in the Chandler AZ location.I have 3 stores because of the concept. But it needs to be executed better.Nicole Sandler

Review.Titre: Question
Review.Contenu: I had to email three times before the person that replied would answer my question. My question was simply "how do I write my address without it looking like a postal box?"Loraine Strattford

Review.Titre: Still new to the process
Review.Contenu: Still new to the process. First mail item did not show up.  The second mail item showed the day I arrived to check on my mail.  Ensure of the process yet.

Review.Titre: There is an opportunity for more price transparency
Review.Contenu: There is an opportunity for more transparency around pick-up, scan and shred charges. I was not aware of this before signing up for the month-to-month payment option.

Review.Titre: Issues with picking up my  mail
Review.Contenu: Well I started getting my mail but when I went to pick it up they had a lot of trouble scanning my mail as picked up after 1/2 an hour they just gave up trying and handed me my letters

Review.Titre: I like that I got an email
Review.Contenu: I like that I got an email but do not understand or like scanning charges I was never told about that extra charge. I do like I was able to go into Staples and get my mail. I am not getting Fed Ex or UPS there just important Government mail so it will be minimal mail I was able to know I got mail via the email not the App so I think the App is an issue getting information on my desk top is difficult perhaps I am not tech savvy but do like your email alarmGinger Coleman

Review.Titre: Mixed Experiences
Review.Contenu: Mixed ExperiencesSometimes getting my mail is easy, and other times it’s a hassle. Sometimes on the mailbox operators side, my account doesn’t show, even though I paid my subscription and have picked up mail before. It will say that I don’t have a mailbox and that I need to complete paperwork,  even though I’ve completed all paperwork and have picked up mail before. This makes tracking down my mail a chore, and worrisome.

Review.Titre: Useful but EXPENSIVE
Review.Contenu: The service is useful especially as an American living internationally but it’s quite expensive. $10/month and $2.25 to scan each piece of mail. Which is essential for me since I’m living abroad and can't be there to pick up the mail. The tab adds up very very quickly. If i want to see just 10 pieces of my mail a month it’s $30 between the baseline cost and the scan cost.

Review.Titre: Ipostal1 was easy to navigate
Review.Contenu: Ipostal1 was easy to navigate. The site offers addresses based on you prefer location.  Some can be pricey.  My advice, contact the location for specific details.  When I purchase my box, I didn’t realize mail is not kept in a “Locked” secured area.  Mail is left in a unsecured slot. In addition, any packages delivered from, let’s say, Amazon, is extra charge.  I would recommend IPostal1.

Review.Titre: Extra Fees Beyond the Annual Rental Reduce the Value of This Service
Review.Contenu: The additional fees associated with holding the mail beyond 30 days and picking it up (instead of having them destroy it) is not an attractive business practice and will discourage me from renewing.  I use the actual mailbox very little, so these fees have me changing my business mail address to my home so I don't have to pay them.  Essentially what this leaves me with is a "premium" address location for which I pay $299/year.

Review.Titre: The USPS questioned your mailing…
Review.Contenu: The USPS questioned your mailing address in Hackettstown NJ, but didn't refuse it. I had to go to Phillipsburg PO to try and make sure everything was ok, and they even sent me a confirmation, but so far only 2 items have come in in 20 days, and your folks said they can't do anything, so I'm waiting it out. The USPS is very inefficient!

Review.Titre: iPostal customer service is very poor
Review.Contenu: iPostal customer service is very poor. Had a problem a few weeks ago and other than a response to "check it out", nothing was actually done.The problem related to forwarding of mail from the Staples center which was being returned to that Staples by USPS for mailing problems. Happened 3 times in a row resulting in delays and costs.

Review.Titre: First time picking up my one mail and…
Review.Contenu: First time picking up my one mail and the envelope was missing. I only received the item (MD Marc train ticket) loose without the envelope.  Also, why was I charged for scanning the one mail i received when I paid for one year for incoming mail service. I shouldn't be charged an additional fee to scan every time I have mail, it should be included with my membership.  I should be reimbursed for the scanned item I was charged.

Review.Titre: Notification
Review.Contenu: I had a package delivered at 3pm on a Thursday and by noon on Friday I still had not been notified that I had any mail.  The company that shipped the package had notified me that the package was delivered but iPostal had not.  I would have expected that by Friday morning I would have got that notification from iPostal.

Review.Titre: Variable service expectation dependent on independently run operation
Review.Contenu: Good concept but overall service and experience with actual mail really depends on the local postal office/location you are dealing with.   Every location is run independently with different owners, offerings and prices.  It would be better if everything is more standardized.   Customer services is highly variable.

Review.Titre: I don't like being charged for picking…
Review.Contenu: I don't like being charged for picking up my mail. Especially when I just spent $149 for a year long service.

Review.Titre: All good except for final step
Review.Contenu: The ipostal system with alerts, features and capabilities is a 5 star.     The amount of wait time I have had the past 3 visits really diminishes the overall experience.    If there is a way to expedite the delivery of mail once at the store, that would be a significant improvement.

Review.Titre: No signage for iPostal1
Review.Contenu: No signage for iPostal1, so I went to shipping/mailing area of Staples.  Waited in line, but person at desk didn’t know about where to direct me and said that area was just for sending items out. So then waited in line at the print center/copies help desk.  Took me 15 minutes of waiting in lines to pick up one envelope.

Review.Titre: Semi-reliable basic service, dropping in quality.
Review.Contenu: It's a really simple service and generally it does what you expect (your mail goes into your box, it's scanned and you can say what to do with it).  We've been customers for several years and the quality of service has dropped steadily.  It can take days to a week for mail to be scanned or for requested action (like a shipment) to be actioned.  They don't bother filling in the "sender" anymore (which was helpful because it was in the emails).  And we regularly get other people's mail, that can take nearly a month to get rerouted to a different mailbox.

Review.Titre: It's always an ordeal to pick up my…
Review.Contenu: It's always an ordeal to pick up my mail...sometimes the associate is not familiar with the process and they have to call over a manager, which takes time.  Also sometimes the app doesn't let me schedule a pick-up, which means I have to wait even longer at the store.

Review.Titre: Consolidated Correspondence Sent to Wrong Address
Review.Contenu: Misplaced correspondence, submitting consolidated mail to the wrong address and charging correspondence pick-up twice are some of the problems I’ve had with this service. I’m still in it because I don’t have another option, but I don’t recommend it to new users.

Review.Titre: Address not normal looking as advertised
Review.Contenu: I did not receive a normal looking address like they promised. The customer service person could only read from his script and wasn't very helpful. My test mail to myself went through fine.

Review.Titre: The thing functions at a basic level
Review.Contenu: The thing functions at a basic level. Interface feels like 1992. You can't have more than one login so if you have an account with your spouse you have to share passwords, which is technically illegal and a violation of guidelines published by the USPS.

Review.Titre: Difficult reaching anyone for help with misplaced box
Review.Contenu: My first and only package delivery thus far didn't go well.It was appropriately addressed, and it was delivered 5.16. Unfortunately I was never delivered and had to make queries. My first email query to support was never addressed. The Chat query resulted in a "we didn't find it." Finally I called the Staples location and a kind employee found it in the wrong box on 5/31. Then I picked it up and was met with a $1 charge for pick-up.

Review.Titre: letterstream was completely functional. no idea why ipostal1 wants a review.
Review.Contenu: Dislike that the website I did business with, letterstream.com, is not in fact ipostal1.com yet here we are talking about ipostal1.  I am still waiting for search engines to evolve such that legit companies only need one domain name to survive on merit.

Review.Titre: The only reason I'm giving this 3 stars…
Review.Contenu: The only reason I'm giving this 3 stars is that I have to pay to pick up my mail/packages. Not sure I would recommend this service to someone who is just starting and doesn't have a lot of money to spend on paying for mail/package pickup.

Review.Titre: Quality depends on site…
Review.Contenu: The design of the service is generally good but the quality is very dependent on the quality of the mailbox physical site you are using. In my case the service is very bad. When I get notified of mail it is always a slew of items with dated postmarks. They only check the box once every 2 weeks or less. The postal customer service is weak. I’ve asked them for assistance several times and they often come back with something like there was a staffing problem but it’s fixed so all good. It is never fixed. It would be difficult to change to an alternate location as the US Postal Service will not forward mail from these types of sites.

Review.Titre: Irritated
Review.Contenu: I’m a digital nomad and was happy with iPostal1 while I was traveling. Now that I have permanently settled, I cancelled my account and put in a forwarding order to my new address. Come to find out, you can’t do a forwarding order. Any mail received after you cancel is returned to sender. I’m sure this was annotated in the fine print somewhere. Just be aware of this before you sign up.

Review.Titre: Hidden fees
Review.Contenu: iPostal1 is convenient, but there are fees that weren't clear when I opened the account. If I'd known that picking up my mail would incur a charge, I wouldn't have used the service. There's a charge to open and scan mail, a charge to send the mail to another address, and even a charge (and appointment required) to show up and pick up the mail. If you pick up the mail, the charge is based on how many letters you're picking up. Seems a little ridiculous to me. Wish I'd read all the small print.

Review.Titre: Good Company, helpfully if you call and stay on top.
Review.Contenu: The system doesn't give you many opportunities if using an outside source for a notary.  Also, it took over two weeks before someone got back to me about what happened with my account.  I'm still not sure if everything is good or not.

Review.Titre: Nice that iPostal is associated with…
Review.Contenu: Nice that iPostal is associated with Staples. Sometimes when I go in to get my mail, they cannot find it. Other times I have picked up my mail, but then I get a notice that I will be charged for storage of the mail that I picked up.

Review.Titre: App very quick and nice but…
Review.Contenu: Overall application is very quick and nice but the prices for scanning each document specially mailed documents is a little bit overpriced.This should be included in the monthly subscription. Especially if its just 2-3 pages.

Review.Titre: I am rather neutral at this point…
Review.Contenu: I am rather neutral at this point because I have not utilized all of the benefits of the service provided.  More monthly information to consumers would be helpful.  I have not had any negative experiences. Easy set up

Review.Titre: For some reason I am not getting any…
Review.Contenu: For some reason I am not getting any notifications at the location I chose.  When I called Staples the employee tells me they don't see my package but I contact the vendor to do a tracking on it. They inform me that package was delivered to the address .

Review.Titre: iPostal1
Review.Contenu: iPostal1, I respectfully would give 4 stars,because a letter "shipment" (why isn't it called "forward") that I requested from my box, just prior to me closing that box, and being shipped to my new iPostal1 box was lost.Your contractor, in the new city, not the old city, I give 3 stars, because the manager has the opinion, all iPostal1 problems are not her concern and without a prior online "pick-up" request, "I will not give you your mail".  Perhaps iPostal1 should remove "prior pick-up request" from your policy and compensate your contractors to update the customers account at each random pick-up???  Otherwise, you & your contractor are doing a great job, thanks.

Review.Titre: Started badly, but they listed to my complaint and sorted it out.
Review.Contenu: My experience with iPostal1 started bad. A few things went wrong and initially they were not put right. But, I complained and they then helped me out. OK, was too late for me, but I really appreciate that they took my complaint seriously and took action.

Review.Titre: Did not realize the mailbox I chose…
Review.Contenu: Did not realize the mailbox I chose would only be accessible during the office building's business hours, or that I would have to schedule pick-ups for my mail. Has been helpful for setting up a virtual small business.

Review.Titre: Your new platform has a critical flaw
Review.Contenu: Your new platform has a critical flaw. The scan of my of my envelope was very poor. Although I would still probably recomend the service, I would caveat it with the recent poor scan. The former platform was better.

Review.Titre: I like the app… but this location for…
Review.Contenu: I like the app… but this location for the mail office is closed. No one is here during the hours of operation. Everything is locked and requires an access key.It’s concerning. I need my mail. Otherwise the app is fine.

Review.Titre: Most everything has been great
Review.Contenu: Most everything has been great.  Easy to use and efficient.Our only concern has been when updating our address for business purposes with USPS and others, we often find the mailbox number, listed after the suite number or in advance of the street address, gets dropped as it is outside the typical address listing structure and does not fit easily into common address verification practices and procedures.

Review.Titre: Forms of ID
Review.Contenu: I think overall it’s a pretty good deal. I do however have a problem with the fact that when I filled out my 1583 form. The notary was fine with the two forms of ID I provided. But Ipostal would not accept my second form of Identification. I also spoke to someone on the phone that told me my second ID form would be fine. But then I get told by Ipostal that they will not accept it as my second form of Identification. In the mean while I receive mail and it was sent back. I am still yet to find out who it was returned to so that I can contact whoever sent the mail and give them an explanation or assure them it will not happen again.

Review.Titre: App Issue with Mail notifications
Review.Contenu: I received my first mail but on my iPhone with the app I didn’t receive any notification. I verified it is setup properly. I did receive an email notification.

Review.Titre: fees
Review.Contenu: Process can be tedious to get started. There are storage fees when you don't pick up mail. The actual facility where your mail goes doesn't know much about ipostal1 process and can't help with setup of account.

Review.Titre: They be more helpful by not leaving out…
Review.Contenu: They be more helpful by not leaving out details giving people the run around and wasting money …however there were “some”great tech support that help get me started

Review.Titre: NOTHING included in your monthly membership
Review.Contenu: I was under the impression 30 items a month were included in my monthly fee of forwarding the mail or scanning the mail etc.  EVERYTHING COST which I don't like and wasn't clearly explained.  Otherwise, it's been fine.

Review.Titre: the system is difficult to get around…
Review.Contenu: the system is difficult to get around in.  Still have not received shipment of mail from them.  hoping its not lost.  hoping to get a tracking # that should have been emailed to me when it shipped out

Review.Titre: The company you hire to do the the…
Review.Contenu: The company you hire to do the the notary. I can send you a half a dozen emails of them telling me I didn't pay for or didn't complete the forms when I had a receipt of payment and copies of the signed forms they still continued to insist that you wouldn't have access and I would not have a box. I sent them copies of the receipt and the signed forms and ID. Then they said well that was retail not business so you have to pay $25 again and do it on the business side. No idea what they were talking about. I didn't you got the forms and ID. I went to staple at 1248 CarMia Way Richmond Virginia. Tina the manager reviewed everything and said, it was the weekend and iPostal1 will update Monday. She was spot on.

Review.Titre: I love the idea of this service but…
Review.Contenu: I love the idea of this service and I believe it will improve the longer I have it. The reason I ranked it low is because I keep getting notifications for mail from the previous owner. The first time I didn't realize it was not addressed to me because the scan I received was so blurry it was hard to make out the words. I went to pick up the piece of mail and they told me it was already shredded because it was the previous owner's but it was still showing up in my account. I understand them continuing to receive the previous owner's mail but I do not think I should be notified about it. I also expected the scan of the mail to be better/clear enough for me to read who it was to and from.

Review.Titre: Just getting started
Review.Contenu: Just getting started, so far, so good.

Review.Titre: First impression
Review.Contenu: First,  I didn't realize there was a fee to pick up my mail.  Disappointed that was not made clear. Second, the staff was less than pleasant when I arrived.  It's going to be a long year and I most likely will not continue with iPostal1

Review.Titre: Reasonably Priced
Review.Contenu: The place is clean, easily accessible, and pricing for an annual mailbox in the Lehigh Valley is lower than the USPS.I wish they were open on a Saturday and the website was more user friendly.

Review.Titre: Staples store not well organized
Review.Contenu: Staples store not well organized; slow to process letters and alert me by email. Employees sometimes do not know the process. Others do. Mail piles up and doesn’t get sorted in timely fashion.

Review.Titre: Great idea. But, you have to pay for delivery and pickup
Review.Contenu: I love the concept of having a virtual mailbox. What I don't like is I have to pay for this service, and also pay to pick up my mail or have it shipped. This really defeats the purpose of having a virtual mailbox if I have to pay for everything. Per the contract, delivery is supposed to be free.

Review.Titre: Just barely good enough...
Review.Contenu: Just barely good enough.... It's shocking how terrible the user experience is, but it does seem to work. I've been successfully receiving mail for a while and have done some scanning and shredding and it all seems to work fine (although pretty expensive). I haven't tried any sends yet, but I'm sure it probably works fine.One thing that was *very* frustrating to discover was that the address they gave me registers as a business address, even though I signed up for a personal residential address. This became really important when I tried to get an auto loan and Chase wouldn't work with me because my "home" address was a Staples. Luckily PNC gave me a loan, but now I've got a home address that everyone seems to know is definitely not a home, which feels really risky.

Review.Titre: Unnecessary hunting
Review.Contenu: Had to hunt to determine that mail had been forwarded. Even when I saw the charge, I couldn't see what mail had actually been forwarded. Won't know for certain until it is received.

Review.Titre: Your sign up is confusing ( notary) and…
Review.Contenu: Your sign up is confusing ( notary) and getting a hold of customer service is not easy and quick. Once the ordeal of signing up is completed it works really well.

Review.Titre: Heavy Advertising/Slow response to inquiry
Review.Contenu: Have had the service a couple months, and received a piece of mail. Asked that the mail be forwarded. A month passes by so I reach out through customer service email, no response. I reach out again two weeks later by phone and was told there was no mail piece. I gave the mail piece number, "then" there was a piece of mail that had been shipped and the issue was now with USPS. Off to a rocky start, but I have my business address tied to this service.  Customer service is lacking based on this interaction, but my goodness they advertise heavy on YouTube. Shift some of those ad dollars to customer service.***Response time was within a couple hours for the lukewarm review, but DAYS for the actual service I paid for. This is an issue when reputation management over good customer service is at hand.

Review.Titre: item delivered but when I show up for…
Review.Contenu: item delivered but when I show up for pick up ,I postal had no clue about my package....Also ,assistant are slow in attending when I come for pick up.....they need to be update

Review.Titre: I was told several different…
Review.Contenu: I was told several different information.  Noone has been able to tell me the same information about what sites have agent services.

Review.Titre: Only 1 of 3 pages scanned
Review.Contenu: Asked Mail to be scanned. They only scanned 1 page. Could not open the rest. Another document had too much tape on it. Took 15 mins to open a letter that was stuck with tape!!

Review.Titre: I am new to iPostal1
Review.Contenu: I am new to iPostal1. I was thinking that some struggles I had with using the mobile app were due to the learning curve. It was not functional on my iPod and clunky and not able to complete tasks on my iPhone. I borrowed a laptop and was able to log in and accomplish everything I needed to do on that. The mobile app needs some attention.

Review.Titre: App needs technical updates
Review.Contenu: Their app needs a technical update. It is very behind on efficiency. The features are nice but they rarely work properly. The staff has been great so far as well

Review.Titre: The staff needs to be trained better
Review.Contenu: The staff needs to be trained better. It seems like there is always someone new and there is only one person that can perform functions. And I'm talking about just simply picking up mail. We are low end users so, the jury is still out.

Review.Titre: Unwanted charges
Review.Contenu: I was not told there would be more money charged for mail over a certain amount.  When some people get a hold of my address, they give my address to others and those people send me stuff I haven't asked for and I don't want.  I get charged for stuff I don't want and I have no easy way of stopping it.

Review.Titre: Needs Updating
Review.Contenu: It's not the best service but it does what it is supposed to do. The app should really be updated and more user friendly. The look of it is very old. No major issues have accurred since I started using the service in late March 2023.

Review.Titre: Rather confusing getting the notary to…
Review.Contenu: Rather confusing getting the notary to verify addresses, instructions from iPostal could be better.  Overall, helpful for me to have a mailbox with them.

Review.Titre: Inconsistent service levels
Review.Contenu: I have 3 iPostal accounts at 2 different locations. Service at 1 is excellent, at the other, unreliable. I don't think iPostal vets their providers adequately

Review.Titre: Don't forget to check the price each location charge
Review.Contenu: Just remember that the price posted on the website doesn't include the additional charges that each location will charge. It adds up.

Review.Titre: Bundles
Review.Contenu: I dislike having only the option to purchase Bundles. Would rather like the opportunity to just bank a set amount. So far, everything else I appreciate.

Review.Titre: SCAM!!!
Review.Contenu: Problem solved! They sent me messages to apologize and reimbursed the notary fess. I appreciate that they take accountability for issues coming from them. ThanksUPDATE!!! It's SCAM!!!!THE BIGGEST SCAM OF THE CENTURY! Hidden fees!!!These guys are just after honest people money.This is a complete garbage, well organized scam. This is not a professional mailing company. They have no control over mail centers they claim as partner. I subscribed since the beginning of August and was charged for it as well as the notarize form which costs $25. waste of money and time because my account has been pending approval since August 7 till today 09/02. It stated pending approval from the mail center itself, so as long as the mail center doesn't give approval, your account stay inactive and useless. I have been calling them and messaging them multiple time but they just ignore the problem. It really upset me since they never called me after multiple attempt to find a solution. They take no responsibility over issues and they don't care about you after you pay for the fees. They never returned my calls and messages even though I called them to complain not once but 10+ time. I remember my last call on Aug 28, when I got my call transferred to at least 7 people saying " would you please hold on, I will transfer you to someone who can help". When I ask how to cancel and get refund for my $9.99 mail subscription + $25 notarization, I was told only the mail center fees are refundable. Meaning I will loose $25 for nothing. Waste of time an money. As of today, no-one called me or messaged me for an update. No fix at all. NOT WORTH IT!This is a scam and I hope people won't get fooled. It's a well organized scam, so don't fall for it.PS: It's easy to talk to someone on the phone when you dial 1 as a new customer. Existing customers calls get rejected and they just redirect you to email them or use the chat box where you just get automatic responses.This is the worse experience ever and it's ridiculous how they treat customers.

Review.Titre: Banking institutions do not accept all…
Review.Contenu: Banking institutions do not accept all virtual addresses. Please have something in place to let customers know they need to check with banking institutions to see if it is acceptable

Review.Titre: Satisfied with room for improvement...
Review.Contenu: The remote access and letter scanning service are great. There however is a lag when I have attempted to have mail forwarded to my saved destination.

Review.Titre: Meh-Not Impressed
Review.Contenu: I appreciate the customer support, however I feel there is little quality control in the company and it may not be the best choice for postal needs.

Review.Titre: Pick up charge
Review.Contenu: I payment monthly fee but still charged to pick up my mail and most timeIt junk but I still have to pay to pick up mail.  Make 1 fee and be done

Review.Titre: Terrible Business Practices and Worse Customer Service
Review.Contenu: Buyer beware! UPDATE:I was able to get ahold of the CS team on my third attempt at contacting them. Gigi and John have been very helpful. I'm still waiting on my refund but I'm satisfied with history handled the issue.END UPDATE I haven't used the service in over a year because I found another option. I just took the loss on the first year because I wasn't sure if I would still need it later or not.It came time for renewal but my card on file expired so that couldn't auto-renew, so I figured that problem would take care of itself, but no. Somehow they managed to charge my new card without my having updated any information with them.Realizing this, I logged into my portal to resolve the issue. I called the customer service number listed, only to be kicked out of the portal and greeted by one of the rudest customer facing people I have encountered. I found out this is Mr. Shipper is Del Rae Beach, and he's not even the right place for me to call. He's the service provider for the address but cannot not do anything related to the account. His demeanor on the phone suggests that he doesn't care about the customer service end of his job. He did provide me with another number to call.I logged back into my account to submit a ticket, only to be kicked of my portal a second time!I called the other number the rude service agent at Mr. Shipper gave me and never got a hold of anyone. After answering their automated questions and waiting for 5 minutes, I was told to leave a message.Based on the other reviews this experience seems to be the exception, or maybe it's the new way they're doing business. Either way, it's been a terrible experience and as of yet, I have had no success in getting recourse for what I consider a fraudulent charge and a terrible customer experience.

I recommend for those reason if you need privacy and convenience. For my particular needs though it was a great service Ipostal1 doesn't meet my particular needs. I wasn't expecting a Private mail box number to be apart of the address line I wish that was advertised up front. The addresses might be good for registering a company but opening a bank account, establishing business credit and a credit business location can pose a problem. Fortunately for me was able to get these issues fictional by obtaining a virtual office, but using Ipostal1 initially resulted in spending more money and time to get things done right for my particular circumstances. I still use it but as mailing address for customers if they need to write or if I need to mail them.
